title: Systemutvecklare
description:
**Din roll hos oss**
--------------------


Som medarbetare hos oss kommer du tillhöra vårt team på sektionen Utveckling och IT som ansvarar för organisationens On-prem Cloud-lösning (OpenShift). Vi arbetar med att stötta våra 40 utvecklingsteam genom att leverera en utvecklings- och driftsmiljö för containeriserade applikationer.


Du kommer att arbeta med våra OpenShift-miljöer och kringliggande integrationer. Vidare ingår arbete både med drift och administration av befintlig miljö men även nyutveckling och expandering av plattformen. Som en del av detta team kommer du fokusera på att förse Lantmäteriet med en stabil och säker plattform, arbeta med administration, automation, konfigurering av säkerhetspolicies, drift i alla steg; från hårdvaran till middlewarelagret, felsökning m.m.


Att ha en god kommunikation och samarbetsförmåga är en viktig del i vårt dagliga arbete, främst med tvärfunktionella team av tekniker och utvecklare. Vi har ett stort fokus på säkerhet och spårbarhet där vi arbetar med infrastruktur som kod (IaC) och övervakning.


På Utveckling och IT har vi ett stort förtroende och tillit till våra medarbetare. Varje team arbetar agilt och självständigt med stor frihet att själva påverka både val av språk och lämpliga tekniker. Detta ger oss en väldiversifierad applikationsstack som ska samexistera på en basplatta baserad på Kubernetes.


**Din profil**
--------------


Du har högskoleutbildning inom IT eller skaffat dig motsvarande kompetens på annat sätt som vi bedömer likvärdigt. Du har erfarenhet och kunskaper i Docker/Podman och Kubernetes, speciellt installera och administrera samt erfarenhet av övervakningsverktyg som Grafana stack, Prometheus, ELK stack eller motsvarande. Du ska även ha kunskaper i skriptspråk som Python och Shell, samt erfarenhet av minst ett programmeringsspråk, exempelvis Golang, Rust, Java eller C++. Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta i Linux-terminalen samt att du har erfarenhet av IT-drift


Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av automationsverktyg som Ansible, ArgoCD, Flux CD eller motsvarande. Det är även meriterande om du är erfaren i Golang eller är bekant med Tekton, Knative, Quay, Nexus, Artifactory.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och ser att du kan anpassa dig och hittar win-win-lösningar genom ett prestigelöst fokus på det gemensamma målet. Du hittar snabbt lösningar på uppkomna problem och ser utanför boxen, tänker i nya banor och finner lösningar på gamla problem. Du håller sig à jour inom din profession och ditt expertområde, omvärlds bevakar och trend spanar. Du tar aktivt initiativ i sociala sammanhang, kliver fram och har lätt för att skapa nya relationer.


Tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad vilket innebär att du måste vara svensk medborgare samt att en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll och säkerhetssamtal kommer att genomföras innan anställning.


**Övrig information**
---------------------


Lantmäteriet är i ständig utveckling och det är också alla vi som jobbar här, våra medarbetare är vår viktigaste resurs för att lyckas med vårt uppdrag. I medarbetarskapet ingår att vi agerar utifrån den statliga värdegrunden och våra värdeord: service, öppenhet och handlingskraft.


Som medarbetare på Lantmäteriet ska du kunna förena arbete med fritid och ha en bra balans i livet. När verksamheten tillåter har du bland annat möjlighet att utföra dina arbetsuppgifter till stor del på annan plats än kontoret. Läs mer om vårt erbjudande på lm.se/jobbahososs


För att skicka in din ansökan, klicka på länken i annonsen. Vi arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering och fokuserar på din kompetens för att bedöma dig och andra kandidater objektivt. Vi önskar att du inte bifogar något foto till din ansökan. Du som har skyddade personuppgifter ska inte lägga in din ansökan i vårt rekryteringssystem, istället ber vi dig kontakta rekryterande chef.


Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om rekryterings- och annonshjälp.


I denna rekrytering tillämpas 6 månaders provanställning.


**Om Lantmäteriet**
-------------------


Lantmäteriet är den myndighet som kartlägger Sverige. Till våra uppgifter hör också att registrera och säkra ägandet av alla fastigheter samt hantera deras gränser. Nu söker vi dig som har ett starkt samhällsengagemang.


Utveckling och IT är en betydelsefull del i Lantmäteriets verksamhet där vi arbetar tillsammans med övriga verksamhetsområden i både strategiska, taktiska och operativa frågor. Vårt uppdrag är att bidra till utvecklingen av Lantmäteriets verksamhet genom att tillhandahålla effektiva lösningar och tjänster. Våra ledord är verksamhetsnytta, säkerhet, innovation och arbetsglädje. Vi har flera stora intressanta utvecklingsprojekt på gång som alla bidrar till samhällets utveckling och där behöver vi dig!

title: Magnolia developer
description:

emagine is looking for an experienced Magnolia Developer for an assignment within banking.

title: Frontend Web Developer
description:
Frontend Web Developer - Gothenburg
  
Why work for Mölnlycke?
  
As part of Mölnlycke's next level of growth, we are accelerating our value creation, leveraging digitalization with new technologies, data and an internal Digital Enablement organization. Looking to deliver increased customer focus, enhanced business collaboration and the adoption of a new DevOps operating model with end-to-end ownership of technology solutions across the organisation.
  
This is a chance to have a real tangible impact within a global business and see how your work directly contributes to the shape of our technological future. You will be empowered to make a true difference, not only for Mölnlycke, but also for patients and health care professionals across the globe.
  
We are now looking to grow our full stack development team with a Frontend Web Developer based in Gothenburg, Sweden. We use agile and DevOps principles to deliver global customer web solutions.
  
Please note. This position requires that you commute to our Gothenburg office 3 days per week. Our future workplace (from early 2025) is GoCo Health innovation city in Mölndal, one of the most attractive workplaces in the city.
  
  

What can we offer you?
  
* The opportunity to be a part of development and implementation of the global IT and Digital Enablement strategy including digital vision & mission and innovation roadmap.
* The opportunity to make a positive impact on the healthcare sector by contributing with digital solutions for customers and healthcare professionals.
* Working with the latest technologies in JavaScript, .NET and using an API based architecture using cloud, AI/ML and more.
* An attractive package including annual bonus, pension, health insurance and wellness contribution.
* Flexible working hours and flexible work from home policy
* Great colleagues in a global company with an open, friendly, and fair working atmosphere.


**About you:**  

In this role, you will be part of the inhouse development team for Mölnlycke Portal, our global Customer Portal for one of our key Business Areas, Operating Room Solutions. The team has an end-to-end accountability for solution discovery, development, solution architecture and operations. You develop scalable solutions using best practices and the latest technology including cloud and AI.
  
The cross functional team consist of a diverse mix of people dedicated to developing great customer experiences using the latest technology and working methods. We value your active engagement, that you proactively are coming with ideas how to achieve the desired outcome and taking a large personal responsibility for the quality of the delivery.
  
  

**Key accountabilities for the role:**  

* Responsibility to build and maintain the user interface of Mölnlycke Portal.
* Responsibility to drive and support delivery team’s mission by developing and maintaining software. Responsibility includes contribution to software development, technical architecture as well as DevOps practices, processes, and tooling.
* Contribute to a solution architecture and design that are flexible, re-usable and compliant with relevant business regulatory, privacy, and security requirements as well as in sync with changing business needs.
* Promotion of best practice development to secure robust solutions.
* Responsible for securing and safeguarding the integrity of the solution in line with solution architecture and UX.


If all that sounds appealing, then here is what we would like you to demonstrate:
  
* Degree in Engineering/Computer Science/Information Technology
* Minimum of 3 years working with frontend development with adept skills in JavaScript frameworks such as Angular or React. Main focus on Angular
* Experience from responsive web design.
* Experience from agile development and DevOps methods


**Additional experience we see as a benefit for the role:**  

Full stack development experience (.NET)
  
Consuming and building REST APIs or GraphQL
  
Cloud solutions such as Azure and Elastic
  
Global web and eCommerce solutions
  
  

About Mölnlycke
  
Mölnlycke is a world-leading medical products and solutions company that equips healthcare professionals to achieve the best patient, clinical and economic outcomes.
  
Our business is organised in the four business areas Wound Care, Operating Room Solutions, Gloves and Antiseptics, where customer centricity, sustainability and digitalisation are at the heart of everything we do.
  
Mölnlycke employs around 8,700 people. The company headquarters are in Gothenburg, Sweden and we operate in more than 100 countries worldwide. Mölnlycke is a founding partner of GoCo Health Innovation City, a world-class innovation cluster for health, and in early 2025 our headquarters will move there.
  
Since 2007, the company has been part of Investor AB, an engaged owner of high-quality, global companies which was founded by the Wallenberg family in 1916. For more information, please visit www.molnlycke.com and www.molnlycke.com/careers
  
  

Our approach to diversity and inclusion
  
At Mölnlycke diversity is not just a vision, but our strength. We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive workplace that values and celebrates the power of diversity. At the heart of our commitment is the belief that diversity fuels innovation, creativity and problem-solving. We invite you to be a part of a team where authenticity is embraced, and every employee, regardless of background or any other traits, experiences a true sense of belonging. Your attitude, drive, enthusiasm, and eagerness to learn are just as important to us as the requirements for the role.
  
If this sounds like you and you feel you have what it takes to succeed in this role, we want to hear from you! Please apply at earliest convenience, we are reviewing candidates continuously.
  
www.molnlycke.com/careers

title: ChopChop söker systemutvecklare
description:
Vi söker en Systemutvecklare!
  
Är du en driven och lösningsorienterad systemutvecklare som älskar att skapa innovativa lösningar? Vill du arbeta i en dynamisk miljö med spännande projekt? Då kan du vara den vi söker!
  
Om tjänsten
  
Som systemutvecklare hos oss kommer du att vara en del av ett engagerat team där du arbetar med att utveckla och underhålla moderna IT-lösningar för våra kunder. Du kommer att få vara med och påverka hela utvecklingsprocessen, från kravinsamling till implementation och leverans. Vi arbetar med de senaste teknikerna och erbjuder stora möjligheter till kompetensutveckling. Tjänsten kräver att du arbetar på plats från vårt kontor.
  
  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**  

Utveckla och underhålla webbaserade applikationer med hjälp av Node.js och Next.js.
  
Samarbeta med utvecklingsteamet för att designa, implementera och förbättra funktioner.
  
Skriva ren, underhållbar och väldokumenterad kod.
  
Felsöka och åtgärda problem för att säkerställa optimal prestanda.
  
Integrera API, tredjepartstjänster och databaser vid behov.
  
Delta i kodgranskningar och bidra till processförbättringar.
  
Hålla dig uppdaterad om branschtrender och tillämpa ny teknologi på projekt.
  
  

**Kvalifikationer:**  

1-3 års erfarenhet av Node.js och Next.js.
  
Goda kunskaper i JavaScript (ES6+) och TypeScript.
  
Erfarenhet av frontend-teknologier (HTML, CSS) och responsiv design.
  
Kunskap om databaser som MongoDB, PostgreSQL eller MySQL.
  
Bekant med versionskontrollsystem, helst Git.
  
Förståelse för RESTful APIoch API-integration.
  
Starka problemlösningsförmågor och noggrann uppmärksamhet på detaljer.
  
Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och i team.
  
Arbetet är förlagd i vårt nya fräscha huvudkontor i Rosersberg.
  
  

**Vi erbjuder:**  

En dynamisk arbetsmiljö med spännande projekt
  
Möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste teknologin
  
Stora möjligheter till vidareutveckling och kompetensutveckling
  
Flexibla arbetstider
  
Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner
  
  

**Arbetsplats:** Gigachop (ChopChop HQ) i Rosersberg.
  
  

**Ansökan:**  

Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev till Jobb@chopchop.se . Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Business Developer / Technical Recruiter Intern
description:
We are looking for a motivated individual that will help 8 Bits Code grow its sales in the Swedish market.
  
Are you passionate about business development and eager to jumpstart your career in the IT consultancy industry? We are looking for a motivated and dynamic Business Development Intern to join our team in Sweden!
  
At 8 Bits Code AB, we specialize in providing highly skilled and experienced consultants to the clients in Sweden. As a Business Development Intern, you’ll gain hands-on experience and contribute to our growth in the Swedish market.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Assist in identifying new business opportunities and generating leads within the IT consultancy space.
  
Support the business development team in preparing proposals, presentations, and sales materials.
  
Research potential clients and market trends to help shape our sales strategies.
  
Collaborate with team members to develop client relationships and identify growth opportunities.
  
Maintain and update database to track progress and client interactions.
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Strong interest in business development, sales, and the IT industry.
  
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  
Fluent in English and Swedish, both written and spoken.
  
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  
Strong research and analytical skills.
  
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
  
  

**Merits (Preferred but not required):**  

Previous experience in recruitment or HR-related activities.
  
Knowledge or interest in IT consultancy services.
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

Hands-on experience in a fast-paced and growing IT consultancy company.
  
Mentorship from experienced business development professionals.
  
Opportunity to gain insights into the Swedish IT market.
  
Potential for growth and long-term opportunities within the company.
  
Flexible working hours with a possibility to work remotely.
  
  

**Location:** Sweden (Remote) Duration: 3-6 months (with potential for extension and permanent job)
  
Ready to kickstart your career? Send your resume and cover letter to [email address] and tell us why you’re a great fit for the role!
  
We look forward to hearing from you!
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: IT-utvecklare
description:
Digitala lösningar för enklare tillgång till juridik! Är du en tech-savvy lagspelare med en fallenhet för smarta tekniska lösningar? EZlegal växer sin digitala plattform och söker nu en utvecklare som vill vara med och modernisera tillgången till juridisk hjälp.
  
EZlegal är en juridisk konsultbyrå som tillhandahåller juridisk rådgivning, tvistlösning och processföring till företag och privatpersoner. Vårt mål är att göra juridiken enkel! Med ett brett utbud av tjänster, tydlig prisbild och flexibel betalning vill vi hjälpa våra kunder när och där det behövs. Vi lägger stor vikt vid digitalisering och innovation i hela verksamheten och ser vårt IT-arbete som en grundläggande del av företagets framgång.
  
  

**Om rollen:**  

Som IT-utvecklare på EZlegal arbetar du med att vidareutveckla våra tekniska plattformar för att möta verksamhetens affärsbehov. Ditt uppdrag är att bygga skalbara digitala lösningar som höjer kundupplevelsen och underlättar våra interna arbetsflöden. Du kommer till stor del att arbeta i Microsoft med fokus på Dynamics 365 och Power BI. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat att omfatta:
  
Bygga processflöden och automatiseringar i Microsoftmiljön.
  
Arbeta med Power BI för att visualisera data och skapa rapporter.
  
Identifiera, analysera och förebygga potentiella IT-risker.
  
Löpande underhåll av samtliga IT-system.
  
  

Vem söker vi?
  
Vi söker en person som är certifierad i Microsoft Dynamics och har god erfarenhet av att arbeta i både Power BI och Azure. Du har en relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT, systemvetenskap eller datavetenskap, alternativt motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet i kombination med relevanta certifieringar. Vi letar efter dig som kan kombinera teknisk know-how med stark problemlösningsförmåga och som inte räds utmanande projekt. Du är initiativrik och självgående i ditt arbete, samtidigt som du har lätt för att samarbeta med andra, även om de inte delar din tekniska bakgrund. Du har inga problem med att kommunicera och arbeta på engelska, och vi ser erfarenhet av backend-utveckling för webbplatser och webbdesign som meriterande.
  
  

**Här finns EZlegal:**  

Många av våra medarbetare sitter i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö, men vi kan också välkomna kollegor på mindre orter i Sverige. Våra kontor finns även i Borås, Vänersborg, Trollhättan, Uppsala, Norrköping, Nyköping, Halmstad och Västerås.
  
  

**Vi erbjuder vår nya kollega:**  

Visstidsanställning med möjlighet till förlängning
  
Kollektivavtalade villkor och försäkringar
  
Tjänstepension
  
Sjukvårdsförsäkring
  
Engagerade chefer och kollegor i teamet
  
God möjlighet till hemarbete
  
Start efter överenskommelse
  
Placering på valfritt kontor
  
  

**Sök den här tjänsten:**  

Skicka in ditt CV, personligt brev och examen med betyg till ansokan@ezlegal.se senast den 30 september. Vi kallar till intervjuer löpande och ser fram emot att få lära känna dig.
  
Kontaktperson för rekrytering är Evelyn Lovelace, HR-Manager evelyn@ezlegal.se
  
Välkommen till EZlegal, där teknik och juridik möts!

title: Senior Linux-utvecklare för inbyggda system – Västerås, heltid
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryteringsföretag. Besök oss på www.modernera.se
  
För en av våra kunders räkning söker vi nu en Senior Linux-utvecklare för inbyggda system. Kunden är ett innovativt teknikföretag som specialiserar sig på att utveckla tekniska lösningar för framtiden inom områden som fordonsindustrin och industriell automation. Företaget erbjuder en kreativ arbetsmiljö där medarbetare uppmuntras att bidra med nya idéer och lösningar.
  
Du kommer att arbeta i trevliga lokaler i centrala Västerås med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.
  
Som senior Linux-utvecklare kommer du att spela en viktig roll i utvecklingen av inbyggda system. Du kommer att vara delaktig i hela utvecklingsprocessen – från kravställning till design, utveckling, testning och implementering av mjukvara för företagets avancerade produkter. Du kommer att samarbeta nära både hårdvaru- och mjukvaruteam.
  
  

**Krav för tjänsten:**  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att utveckla för Linux i C, med verktyg som Make och GDB.
* Erfarenhet av nätverksverktyg som iproute2, ethtool, tcpdump och Wireshark.
* Det är fördelaktigt med kunskap om nätverksprotokoll som Ethernet och IP, samt erfarenhet av verktyg som sysrepo, netopeer2 och libyang.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet från kärnutveckling ses som starkt meriterande.


**Du får:**  

* En spännande och utmanande roll i ett expansivt företag.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med avancerad teknik och innovativa projekt.
* Flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete.
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner.
* En positiv arbetsmiljö med engagerade och kunniga kollegor.


Du kommer att anställas direkt hos vår kund. Anställningsformen är heltid, med en initial provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträdet är omgående.
  
För att ansöka, skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Ange "Senior Linux-utvecklare för inbyggda system – Västerås, heltid" i ämnesraden.

title: Systemutvecklare
description:
Är du en problemlösare som drivs av att hitta smarta lösningar och vill vara en del av ett team som tillsammans skapar mervärde för våra kunder och bidrar till samhällsnytta? Då kan tjänsten som utvecklare av vårt verksamhetssystem vara en perfekt roll för dig.
  
Vi växer och vårt utvecklarteam i Växjö behöver förstärka teamet med en kollega.
  
  

Aveki
  
Vi utvecklar GIS-baserade verksamhetssystem för samhällsbyggnadssektorn. Våra system i kombination med vår unika kompetens och erfarenhet skapar en enklare och effektivare vardag för våra kunder. Vår specialitet är att utveckla helhetslösningar för kommuner och organisationer som har ett behov av att integrera geografisk information med övrig verksamhetsdata. Över hälften av Sveriges kommuner är kunder till oss och vi har vuxit varje år sedan starten 2001.
  
  

Dina arbetsuppgifter
  
I rollen som systemutvecklare kommer du att arbeta med att nyutveckla och bygga på mer funktionaliteter i våra produkter. Du kommer även att arbeta med förvaltning och underhåll av befintlig kod.
  
Utveckling sker i C#, .Net i en agil utvecklingsmiljö med dagliga stand-ups.
  
Det är en bred roll och du är delaktig i alla faser av utvecklingen från krav, design, implementering, testning och förvaltning.
  
  

**I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår bland annat:**  

* Utveckling av nya funktioner
* Förvaltning och utveckling av befintliga funktioner
* Allt från Backend-tjänster, webbapplikationer till avancerade desktoplösningar


Vem söker vi?
  
Du har en relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom IT, till exempel systemvetenskap, datavetenskap eller dylikt.
  
  

**Vi söker dig med:**  

* Goda kunskaper inom programmering, helst objektorienterad programmering
* Erfarenhet av programmering i .Net
* Goda kunskaper i C#


Som person har du en god analytisk förmåga och tar stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter. Du har fallenhet för att se helheten men kan också grotta ner dig i detaljer. Du gillar utmanande problemställningar och att skapa högkvalitativa lösningar med de senaste verktygen. Vi ser även gärna att du är initiativtagande och gillar att dela din kunskap inom teamet.
  
  

Varför bli en av oss?
  
Aveki är ett tryggt och stabilt företag med stark ekonomi och tillväxt. Som nyanställd hos oss kommer du att få en gedigen upplärning och omfattas av vår onboarding-process med en dedikerad mentor, för att ge dig de bästa möjliga förutsättningarna i ditt nya jobb.
  
Vi sitter i nyrenoverade lokaler i Företagsstaden I11 i Växjö.
  
Vår företagskultur präglas av familjär omtanke, nyfikenhet och gott samarbete. Vi delar med oss av vår kunskap och är öppna för varandras åsikter och idéer. Medarbetarna är vår viktigaste resurs och vi uppmuntrar kompetensutveckling. Vi är måna om en god balans mellan arbetsliv och fritid och erbjuder dig förmåner som till exempel förmånligt friskvårdsbidrag, frukost och sjukförsäkring.
  
  

Skicka in din ansökan redan idag - urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning kan ske före sista ansökningsdag. Skicka ditt CV tillsammans med ett personligt brev till: jobb@aveki.se.
  
Sista ansökningsdag är den 30 oktober.
  
Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta HR-ansvarig Elin Jonsson på 0709-68 30 20 eller jobb@aveki.se.

title: Business Developer - Salesforce
description:
Introduction  

As a Package Consultant at IBM, get ready to tackle numerous mission-critical company directives. Our team takes on the challenge of designing, developing and re-engineering highly complex application components and integrating software packages using various tools. You will use a mix of consultative skills, business knowledge, and technical expertise to effectively integrate packaged technology into our clients' business environment and achieve business results.  

  

Your Role and Responsibilities  

Go to market and sales for Salesforce towards Swedish accounts, add-on sales to current SAP deals as well as work on signing new clients.  

  

Required Technical and Professional Expertise  

1. Salesforce Platform Knowledge: Proficiency in Salesforce, including but not limited to:* Familiarity with Salesforce data models, including accounts, contacts, and opportunities
* Ability to navigate and use Salesforce features, such as dashboards, reports, and workflows


2. Cloud Computing and Software as a Service (SaaS): Understanding of cloud-based technologies, including:* Cloud infrastructure and deployment models
* SaaS business models and benefits
* Familiarity with Salesforce cloud infrastructure and services


3. Sales and Business Development: Proven track record of sales success, including:* B2B sales experience
* Understanding of sales strategies and tactics
* Ability to build and maintain relationships with customers and partners


4. Understanding of Complex Sales Environments: Ability to navigate complex sales environments, including:* Understanding of sales processes, including RFIs, RFPs, and demos
* Familiarity with sales tools, such as sales automation platforms and CRM systems
* Ability to manage and mitigate risks associated with large-scale sales


5. Communication and Interpersonal Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including:* Ability to effectively communicate with customers, sales teams, and management
* Strong active listening and problem-solving skills
* Ability to work in a team environment

  

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise  

1. Large Enterprise Sales Experience: Proven experience selling to large enterprise organizations, including:* Understanding of complex sales environments and buying processes
* Ability to navigate and influence multiple stakeholders, including executive sponsors, IT decision-makers, and business leaders
* Experience with large-scale implementations and deployments


2. Executive-Level Communication: Ability to effectively communicate with executive-level decision-makers, including:* Understanding of executive-level concerns and priorities
* Ability to communicate complex technical information in a clear and concise manner
* Ability to build and maintain relationships with executive sponsors


3. Strategic Thinking: Ability to think strategically and develop sales strategies that align with business objectives, including:* Understanding of business objectives and key performance indicators (KPIs)
* Ability to develop and execute sales plans that meet or exceed sales targets
* Ability to analyze sales data and make informed decisions

  

About Business UnitIBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.  

  

Your Life @ IBMIn a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.
Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.


Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.


Are you ready to be an IBMer?

  

About IBMIBM's greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.  

  

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.
  

  

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.  

  

Location StatementIBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.  

  

Being You @ IBMIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, caste, genetics, pregnancy, disability, neurodivergence, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Webbutvecklare
description:
**Vill du jobba som webbutvecklare på digitalbyrån Fröjd?**


Vi söker dig som har minst fyra års erfarenhet av att arbeta professionellt som webbutvecklare, och som vill jobba i team nära designers och andra utvecklare för att skapa grymma digitala upplevelser för våra kunder. Det som är viktigt för oss är inte att du är fullärd, utan att du har en positiv attityd och ett intresse för att lära dig nya saker.

**Vi tror att du**

* Har jobbat professionellt med webbutveckling på t.ex. digitalbyrå eller som konsult
* Tycker om frontend (HTML, CSS/SCSS, Javascript) och har erfarenhet av React eller liknande ramverk
* Vill arbeta både med frontend och backend
* Har ett nyfiket sinne och är intresserad av att sätta dig in i andra språk/plattformar
* Brinner för utveckling och gillar att jobba i både team och självständigt
* Har jobbat med backend i något ramverk eller CMS

**Det är lite extra bra (men inget krav) om du**

* Har öga för detaljer
* Har erfarenhet av Pyton/Django, Wagtail, Optimizely, Umbraco, Contentful eller WordPress
* Har varit lead för projekt

**Vi erbjuder dig**


En öppen kultur där variation är en del av vardagen. Du får möjlighet att testa olika tekniker i olika typer av projekt inom olika branscher. På Fröjd jobbar idag 20 härliga utvecklare som alla gillar att dela med sig av sina kunskaper och att lösa utmaningar tillsammans.


Vi tycker det är viktigt att man som anställd på Fröjd lyckas lägga sitt livspussel på ett bra sätt och har därför flexibla arbetstider och erbjuder möjligheten att jobba hemifrån om man föredrar eller behöver.


Vi tycker att lärande är en stor del av jobbet och därför jobbar vi aktivt med kompetensutveckling genom utvecklarworkshops, bubbel & babbel och konferenser. Vi älskar open source och att dela med oss av våra lösningar på github.com/frojd. Som nyanställd utvecklare på Fröjd får du handledning av en mentor, och vi lägger stort fokus på att på ett tydligt och bra sätt introducera dig till våra arbetssätt och tekniker.

  

Hos oss får du

  

* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Sex veckors semester
* Tjänstepension och viktiga försäkringar
* Hem-arbetsplats-bidrag
* Teamaktiviteter
* Måndagsfrukost
* Cykelförmån
* Jämställt team


Läs om varför du skulle gilla att jobba hos oss på frojd.se/karriar.

**Om Fröjd**


Vi tror på magin som skapas när affärsförståelse, kreation och teknik möts och vi vet att det är våra medarbetare som gör oss till en glimrande digitalbyrå. Är du nyfiken, vill bli utmanad, jobba i team och lära nytt hela tiden, då skulle du alldeles säkert gilla att jobba på Fröjd!


Vi sitter centralt i fint kontor på Torsgatan 26, mitt emellan S:t Eriksplan, Odenplan och Centralen.

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Mjukvaruutvecklare – Sensorbaserad mätteknik
description:
**Plats:** Göteborg


**Sista ansökningsdag:** Löpande


**Om Atritec**
Som en ledande aktör inom maskinell mätning för järnväg och väg, fortsätter Atritec att driva innovation och teknisk utveckling inom infrastrukturbranschen. Vi är en ledande kraft inom applicerad sensorteknik för mätteknik på den nordiska marknaden. Vår expertis sträcker sig genom avancerade system som lidar, kameror och positioneringssystem, vilka är centrala för vår verksamhet och innovation. Genom att ansluta dig till vårt team får du möjlighet att arbeta i frontlinjen av teknisk utveckling, där dina insatser direkt bidrar till smartare och mer effektiva lösningar för vårt samhälles infrastruktur.


**Varför jobba hos oss**
Atritec är mer än bara en plats att arbeta på; det är en plats där du kan växa, påverka och vara en del av en spännande framtid. Vår kultur genomsyras av en ”grundarmentalitet” som uppmuntrar varje medarbetare att ta initiativ och tänka innovativt. Vi är ett team av problemlösare, doers och ständiga lärlingar som inte bara följer trender och best practise – vi skapar dem.


Vårt team är vårt största kapital, och vi investerar i varje medarbetares utveckling genom kontinuerlig utbildning, mentorskap och tillgång till de senaste verktygen och teknologierna. Vi värderar balansen mellan arbete och privatliv och strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla kan trivas och prestera sitt bästa.


**Rollbeskrivning**
Som mjukvaruutvecklare på Atritec kommer du att ha en avgörande roll i utvecklingen av mjukvara som interagerar med vår toppmoderna sensorteknik. Du kommer att designa, utveckla och optimera system som hanterar och analyserar data från våra avancerade sensorsystem, vilket ger våra kunder unika insikter och förbättrade beslutsunderlag. Du kommer att arbeta i ett tight team med specialister inom sensorteknik och därtill närbesläktade områden.


**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Utveckla och underhålla mjukvarusystem för hantering och bearbetning av data från lidar, kameror och positioneringssystem.
* Samarbeta nära med resten av utvecklingsteamet för att integrera nya sensorlösningar och förbättra befintliga applikationer.
* Delta i alla faser av mjukvaruutvecklingsprocessen, från kravanalys och systemdesign till implementering och underhåll.
* Bidra till kontinuerlig förbättring av våra mjukvaruutvecklingsmetoder och -processer.

**Om Dig**


Vi söker dig som har:


* Har relevant högskoleutbildning inom datavetenskap, mjukvaruutveckling, teknisk fysik eller liknande.
* Besitter starka programmeringskunskaper i språk som Python och C++.
* Är driven och engagerad i projekten du tar dig ann.
* Känner stort ägande dina projekt och uppdrag.
* Jobbar effektivt såväl självständigt som i team.
* Är en innovativ tänkare som trivs med att lösa komplexa tekniska problem.

Det är meriterande om du:


* Har erfarenhet av att utveckla mjukvara som interagerar med sensorer såsom lidar, kameror eller GPS-system.
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med frontend, REST, dataprocessering eller AI. Tidigare erfarenhet av GIS, PCL (eller liknande) är också ett plus.

**Vi Erbjuder**


* En unik chans att arbeta med banbrytande sensorteknik.
* Ett stimulerande arbetsklimat där dina idéer och bidrag värdesätts.
* Möjlighet till karriärutveckling inom ett företag som är ledande inom sin bransch.
* En möjlighet att positivt bidra till en mer hållbar samhällsinfrastruktur.
* Konkurrenskraftigt ersättning och flexibla arbetsförhållanden.

**Ansökning**
Är du redo att utveckla framtiden med Atritec? Skicka in din ansökan bestående av CV och personligt brev via vår ansökningssida.


För mer information om tjänsten, kontakta Andreas Nordin, andreas.nordin@atritec.se.


Välkommen att bli en del av ett team där teknik möter innovation!


  
### **Vill du veta mer?**

Kontakta oss för att få mer information om denna position.


* **Linus Olsson**
* +46 73 808 90 73

title: Platform Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

 **About this opportunity**


As the tech firm that created the mobile world, and with more than 54,000 patents to our name, we’ve made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology. This is a place where you're welcomed as your own perfectly unique self, and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team. Are you in?  

Come, and be where it begins.  

  

We are looking for an Experienced Software Developer to strengthen the Solution Industrialization team of the Ericsson Wallet platform!  

At Mobile Financial Services (MFS) we enable financial inclusion - truly using Technology for doing good in society! Our systems are used by hundreds of millions every day. We use the latest and greatest tech and techniques to guarantee state-of-the-art software with premium quality. At the Karlskrona site we have our main headquarters for MFS in which we develop one of the world's largest Fintech products.  

The Ericsson Wallet Platform (EWP) is a product which enables our customers to provide mobile financial services. Our customers are operators and banks, we build our financial platform to help bring financial freedom to many people around the World.

 **What you will do**


You have the chance to be part of a growing and dynamic development organization that will develop new features using the latest technology and work on improving the current platform and deployment models and reference solutions.

* Work with software development by analysing and implementing business requirements from product management.
* Work in all phases of the product's life cycle, including design, implementation, verification, maintenance, and operations of our solutions.
* Our ways of working are based on agile DevOps principles, where Continuous Integration is a cornerstone in our development methodology!
* Working with Continuous Improvement and solution maintenance is also part of the role.
* We offer the possibility to have a high growth in your software developer role (including technical leadership) and being challenged in different roles.

 **The skills you bring**

* BSc or higher equivalent education in Software Engineering, Computer Science or similar.
* Solid object-oriented Java (Enterprise) programming skills.
* Experience in Software development environments and tools.
* Experience in Public Cloud Deployment and Containerization.
* Experience from working with DevOps and Agile principles and a willingness to work in a flexible team environment.
* Great social skills, flexibility, and a willingness to adapt and respond to a change.
* Curiosity and eagerness to learn new things.
* A positive and inspiring approach in your everyday work.
* Independent, goal-oriented and systematic way of working.
* English proficiency both written and spoken.

 **Application**  

We look forward to your application with CV in English.  

Last day to apply: 26th of September 2024  

Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.  

If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Raheleh Rouhani, Sr. Recruiter at raheleh.rouhani@ericsson.com  

Location: Karlskrona, Sweden

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.

 **Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Karlskrona

**Req ID:** 753980

title: Digital Project manager and Business Developer
description:
*Research shows that women and other under-represented groups within our industry hesitate to apply unless they tick most boxes of a role description. At Stegra, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core. We need a diverse, inclusive, and authentic team to rally behind our purpose of de-carbonizing hard-to-abate industries, starting with steel.*  

  

*So, i**f you are equally passionate about our purpose yet concerned that your experience doesn**’**t* *perfectly* *align with the qualifications stated in the job advert, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate, either for this role – or for another upcoming role in our* *rapidly* *growing* *business**.*

**About us:**


Stegra, formerly known as H2 Green Steel, is on a mission to disrupt the global steel industry by producing green steel, with the end goal of bringing down CO2 emissions to zero. By using green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity instead of coal; water and heat will be our primary emissions. By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitalized, and sustainable plant in Boden, located in northern Sweden - currently in construction phase. But this is just the beginning – our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize other industries in addition to steel, and we look forward to what’s next in store for us.


We are looking for talented, innovative, and purpose-driven people to join our rapidly growing and diverse team. Our employees get to learn everyday, implement the latest technology and test and put their ideas into practice. Together, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core – for our people, customers, investors, society, and planet.

 **Digital Project manager and Business Developer**


As a project manager within Digital & Business Development, you will own and lead the digital and business development agenda for a prioritized business unit. It is a broad responsibility that involves both creating an overall roadmap that ensures business objectives as well as execution on that roadmap. You will lead prioritized initiatives, and ensure that the value of each initiative is realized by driving implementation and change management for the involved business unit. You will also lead a digital development team to implement digital solutions and, in that way, ensure a true connection between the business development and digital development agenda.


While the responsibility focuses on a certain business unit, your true mission lies in enhancing productivity and collaboration in cross-functional value flows. It will be your responsibility to use our cross-functional approach to bring clarity on what is unclear and to bring the right people together to ensure value is optimized for the company in total. Strong emphasis will therefore be on your influential skills and your ability to understand what truly needs to be solved, and to be the enzyme to push those cross-functional conversations forward – also when functional priorities might be contradictory.


Our organization is rapidly growing, meaning that an important skill in this role is to enjoy working in a dynamic environment where both roles, scopes and needs might change over time.


**Responsibilities:**


* Build and own the business and digital development roadmap for a prioritized business unit
* Manage priorities towards that roadmap by balancing Stegra overall goals as well as the value creation for each business function
* Lead a digital development team, which involves
* Responsibility for the deliveries of the team
* Ensure the right resources in the team to execute on the defined roadmap
* Ensure productivity in the team by fostering team dynamics and efficient ways of working
* Run cross-functional initiatives within digital and business development. The initiatives will start at scope and issue definition and continue with execution and evaluation of outcomes as well as ensuring a process and responsibility for continuous improvements

Contribute by advocating and fulfilling Stegra’s digital strategy and ways of working within the initiatives and with the stakeholders you operate with  

* 

  

**Qualifications:**


* Relevant experience in management consulting, digital and business development, product management or related experience, working with operational excellence and process improvement; high-growth or early-stage start-up experience is a bonus
* A degree in Engineering or Business
* Experience in leading large cross-functional initiatives
* Experience with digital transformation initiatives and software solution development.
* Experience in reporting to C-level steering committees

Experience working with business and process development for corporate functions (finance, legal, procurement, human resources, etc.) within the manufacturing industry is a strong bonus  

* 

  

**Skills:**


* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
* The ability to influence and lead cross-functional teams
* The ability to drive change at all organizational levels – communicate and operate both at C-level to enable fast and informed decisions, as well as to operate integrated with digital teams, developers, and architects on detailed solution outlines.
* The ability to lead change effectively by your strong mindset to push things forward with the combination of humbleness and the ability to understand and read your surroundings
* The ability to build strong team spirit in different contexts where you are involved to make people feel dedicated to contributing on a solution

A positive can-do attitude: a personality that enjoys working in a dynamic, collaborative, innovative high-growth, fast-paced environment  

* 

  

**What we can offer you**  



If you are passionate about making actual change and having a positive impact on society and our planet, Stegra offers a unique opportunity to be part of a fun and professional team with high ambitions.


You will get the opportunity to shape your future career together with a company focusing on creating a culture where everyone can thrive and feel a sense of belonging. In the end, we know that Stegra’s growth and success is dependent on our people and we can’t wait to shape the future of steelmaking and other industries together as a team.

title: Concept Developer - Hydrogen Technology
description:
*Research shows that women and other under-represented groups within our industry hesitate to apply unless they tick most boxes of a role description. At Stegra, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core. We need a diverse, inclusive, and authentic team to rally behind our purpose of de-carbonizing hard-to-abate industries, starting with steel.*  

  

*So, i**f you are equally passionate about our purpose yet concerned that your experience doesn**’**t* *perfectly* *align with the qualifications stated in the job advert, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate, either for this role – or for another upcoming role in our* *rapidly* *growing* *business**.*

**About us:**


Stegra, formerly known as H2 Green Steel, is on a mission to disrupt the global steel industry by producing green steel, with the end goal of bringing down CO2 emissions to zero. By using green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity instead of coal; water and heat will be our primary emissions. By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitalized, and sustainable plant in Boden, located in northern Sweden - currently in construction phase. But this is just the beginning – our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize other industries in addition to steel, and we look forward to what’s next in store for us.


We are looking for talented, innovative, and purpose-driven people to join our rapidly growing and diverse team. Our employees get to learn everyday, implement the latest technology and test and put their ideas into practice. Together, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core – for our people, customers, investors, society, and planet.  

  

**Concept Developer - Hydrogen Technology**


As the Concept Developer in the Hydrogen Projects team you will develop, analyze and continuously support the new hydrogen projects and technical concepts to be deployed, focusing on early-stage evaluations and innovation. You will lead the work to establish a technical baseline for new hydrogen projects and validate the feasibility and attractiveness of such projects. You will also be driving the work to standardize and digitize Stegra' approach to new projects, including qualitative and quantitative materials and models. You will work in a cross-functional environment aimed at helping Stegra build our project portfolio.


The role is based in Stockholm, Sweden, with regular travel to various locations as required.


**Responsibilities:**


* Represent Hydrogen Technology in engagements on new early-stage projects (concept and early engineering phase), incl. channeling of information between projects and representing Hydrogen Technology in new project developments.
* Identify, develop and manage the technical baseline and related queries for new hydrogen projects, including communication and collaboration with both internal and external counterparts.
* Build the tools and models for how Stegra identifies and develops the most attractive new projects.
* Run techno-economic analyses on plant design and technology choices and situations.
* Monitor and evaluate new hydrogen technologies and its applicability for new projects, including hydrogen storage technologies and use cases for intermittent power profiles and electrolyzer capacities.
* Coordinate all technical efforts from engineering to vendor relations in new project developments.

**Qualifications**


* Minimum bachelor’s degree in engineering, business, project management, or a relevant field required; master’s degree preferred.
* Minimum 1-2 years of experience as technical and/or business analyst, technical business developer, management consultant or similar role in the technical and/or business development field.
* Experience in problem-solving within analytical situations and a strong interest in developing your analytical skills.
* Good coordination and stakeholder management abilities, with experience in multi-disciplinary project teams. You enjoy collaborating with others and helping to drive projects forward.
* Comfortable working in a dynamic environment and capable of independently planning and prioritizing your tasks to achieve set goals.

**What we can offer you**  



If you are passionate about making actual change and having a positive impact on society and our planet, Stegra offers a unique opportunity to be part of a fun and professional team with high ambitions.


You will get the opportunity to shape your future career together with a company focusing on creating a culture where everyone can thrive and feel a sense of belonging. In the end, we know that Stegra’s growth and success is dependent on our people and we can’t wait to shape the future of steelmaking and other industries together as a team.

title: Software Developer
description:
*Research shows that women and other under-represented groups within our industry hesitate to apply unless they tick most boxes of a role description. At Stegra, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core. We need a diverse, inclusive, and authentic team to rally behind our purpose of de-carbonizing hard-to-abate industries, starting with steel.*  

  

*So, i**f you are equally passionate about our purpose yet concerned that your experience doesn**’**t* *perfectly* *align with the qualifications stated in the job advert, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate, either for this role – or for another upcoming role in our* *rapidly* *growing* *business**.*

**About us:**


Stegra, formerly known as H2 Green Steel, is on a mission to disrupt the global steel industry by producing green steel, with the end goal of bringing down CO2 emissions to zero. By using green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity instead of coal; water and heat will be our primary emissions. By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitalized, and sustainable plant in Boden, located in northern Sweden - currently in construction phase. But this is just the beginning – our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize other industries in addition to steel, and we look forward to what’s next in store for us.


We are looking for talented, innovative, and purpose-driven people to join our rapidly growing and diverse team. Our employees get to learn everyday, implement the latest technology and test and put their ideas into practice. Together, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core – for our people, customers, investors, society, and planet.

##### **Software Developer**


At Stegra Digital we believe in business truthfulness and accordingly work in business aligned cross functional teams. Our teams work with operations *and* development over the whole digital technology stack: integrations, operations, analytical data and front end. We want you and your teammates to grow outside your respective areas of expertise to solve business’ challenges as they occur.


We are looking for developers who are passionate believers in microservice principles and wants to build a truly digital organization. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our microservice infrastructure, with a focus on enabling tailored solutions and integrations as required by our business. You will work closely with domain experts to understand their ways of working and build solutions that meet those needs. You will also be responsible for developing and maintaining our DevSecOps procedures and governance policies.


This position is based in Boden and is part of Stegra’s Digital Factory Team.

 **About seniority**


We are actively seeking developers with varying levels of expertise, ranging from recent university graduates to seasoned professionals. The level of seniority you bring will correspond to the qualifications and experiences outlined below, with more senior candidates expected to possess a broader spectrum of these attributes.

**Some soft qualities we value.**

* You are curious about new things, but always balancing new ideas towards existing wisdom.
* You appreciate diverse viewpoints when tackling challenges yet understands the significance of reaching a consensus and adhering to the established pattern for effective collaboration.
* You are passionate about what you are doing and have a genuine interest in delivering great solutions.
* You embody a service-oriented mindset, making yourself accessible to your business colleagues. Recognizing that value is substantiated when business needs are met.
* You communicate effortlessly both verbally and in writing with colleagues and external parties within completely different domains/areas of expertise.
* You possess the ability to analyze and break down a bigger problem into smaller, graspable parts.
* You appreciate the importance of understanding and connecting with the organization's mission, goals, and strategies.

**Qualifications we look** **for**

* An academic degree in computer science, data science or a related field, or equivalent practical experience

**Tech knowledge and experience we appreciate**


We are building teams in several disciplines and we are looking for a broad range of skill sets. For some examples, see below

* Development experience from event driven microservice environments using RESTful APIs
* Kotlin and Spring Boot in containerized environments
* IT/OT integrations and process design in edge nodes towards process equipment
* Message-broker platforms like RabbitMQ or similar.
* Automated software building, testing and deployment using GitLab CI/CD
* Infrastructure as Code using Terraform
* Hands on experience working with Kubernetes clusters or similar
* Hands on experience working with AWS S3, Snowflake and dbt or similar


In our agile environment, every team requires a dedicated agile servant to unlock its full potential. If you're passionate about fostering team efficiency and collaboration, you may also be an ideal scrum master.

 **What we can offer you**  



If you are passionate about making actual change and having a positive impact on society and our planet, Stegra offers a unique opportunity to be part of a fun and professional team with high ambitions.


You will get the opportunity to shape your future career together with a company focusing on creating a culture where everyone can thrive and feel a sense of belonging. In the end, we know that Stegra’s growth and success is dependent on our people and we can’t wait to shape the future of steelmaking and other industries together as a team.

title: Android Developer
description:
We're looking for Android developers of all experience levels to join Primea and our consultancy projects, based in either Gothenburg or Stockholm.


We build compelling and complex web applications on a daily basis, utilizing bleeding-edge technologies but make sure that they are proven, reliable and relevant for the problem in question. To best serve our clients and end-users, you'll delve into new concepts every day, and always be looking for new, innovative ways to solve the problems we have at hand. Curiosity, collaboration and willingness to learn will get you far, we are always humble when taking on new challenges, and at the same time eager to get going.


As a Android developer at Primea, you will have the privilege to work in a competent, cross-functional team where your focus on the frontend will be highly appreciated and important. Since you've been working in a professional setting before, you will fit right into any given team you'll end up in. You know, as well as us, that the world of frontend moves faster and faster for every day that passes, but the core concepts in every new framework are the same. Since you have a good understanding of at least one of the major frameworks and build systems, you know that picking up another one, if required, won't be of any problem to you.

 **WHAT YOU WILL ADD**

* Demonstrated success in delivering professional Android projects
* Advanced skills in Android development
* Strong understanding of app architecture with a focus on code quality
* Experience in functional testing and performance optimization
* Knowledge of design principles and best practices
* Ability to work collaboratively using version control systems

**OUR OFFER TO YOU**

  

* Great colleagues, flexible company and fun projects
* Hackaways - Developer conferences in and outside of Sweden
* Learning opportunities during our knowledge sharing sessions
* Travels to different locations where we have office spaces around the world
* Possibility to become co-founder & shareholder in our spin-off companies
* Competitive salary and benefit package


Does this sound like something for you? Would you like to join a company where your personal and professional development is in focus? Show us your interest by applying as soon as possible!

title: Frontend Developer
description:
We're looking for frontend developers of all experience levels to join Primea and our consultancy projects, based in either Gothenburg or Stockholm.


We build compelling and complex web applications on a daily basis, utilizing bleeding-edge technologies but make sure that they are proven, reliable and relevant for the problem in question. To best serve our clients and end-users, you'll delve into new concepts every day, and always be looking for new, innovative ways to solve the problems we have at hand. Curiosity, collaboration and willingness to learn will get you far, we are always humble when taking on new challenges, and at the same time eager to get going.


As a frontend developer at Primea, you will have the privilege to work in a competent, cross-functional team where your focus on the frontend will be highly appreciated and important. Since you've been working in a professional setting before, you will fit right into any given team you'll end up in. You know, as well as us, that the world of frontend moves faster and faster for every day that passes, but the core concepts in every new framework are the same. Since you have a good understanding of at least one of the major frontend frameworks and build systems, you know that picking up another one, if required, won't be of any problem to you.

**OUR OFFER TO YOU**

* Great colleagues, flexible company and fun projects
* Hackaways - Developer conferences in and outside of Sweden
* Learning opportunities during our knowledge sharing sessions
* Travels to different locations where we have office spaces around the world
* Possibility to become co-founder & shareholder in our spin-off companies
* Competitive salary and benefit package


Does this sound like something for you? Would you like to join a company where your personal and professional development is in focus? Show us your interest by applying as soon as possible!

title: Software Developer - Backend
description:
*Research shows that women and other under-represented groups within our industry hesitate to apply unless they tick most boxes of a role description. At Stegra, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core. We need a diverse, inclusive, and authentic team to rally behind our purpose of de-carbonizing hard-to-abate industries, starting with steel.*  

  

*So, i**f you are equally passionate about our purpose yet concerned that your experience doesn**’**t* *perfectly* *align with the qualifications stated in the job advert, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate, either for this role – or for another upcoming role in our* *rapidly* *growing* *business**.*

**About us:**


Stegra, formerly known as H2 Green Steel, is on a mission to disrupt the global steel industry by producing green steel, with the end goal of bringing down CO2 emissions to zero. By using green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity instead of coal; water and heat will be our primary emissions. By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitalized, and sustainable plant in Boden, located in northern Sweden - currently in construction phase. But this is just the beginning – our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize other industries in addition to steel, and we look forward to what’s next in store for us.  

  

**Software Developer - Backend**


At Stegra Digital we believe in business truthfulness and accordingly work in business aligned cross functional teams. Our teams work with operations *and* development over the whole digital technology stack: integrations, operations, analytical data and front end. We want you and your teammates to grow outside your respective areas of expertise to solve business’ challenges as they occur.


We are looking for a Software Developer who is a passionate believer in microservice principles and wants to build a truly digital organization. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our microservice infrastructure, with a focus on enabling tailored solutions and integrations as required by our business. You will work closely with domain experts to understand their ways of working and build solutions that meet those needs. You will also be responsible for developing and maintaining our DevSecOps procedures and governance policies.


This position is based in Stockholm and is part of Stegra’s Digital Team.


Applications will be reviewed from 5th of August.


**About seniority**


We are actively seeking developers with varying levels of expertise, ranging from recent university graduates to seasoned professionals. The level of seniority you bring will correspond to the qualifications and experiences outlined below, with more senior candidates expected to possess a broader spectrum of these attributes.


**Some soft qualities we value.**


* You are curious about new things, but always balancing new ideas towards existing wisdom.
* You appreciate diverse viewpoints when tackling challenges yet understands the significance of reaching a consensus and adhering to the established pattern for effective collaboration.
* You are passionate about what you are doing and have a genuine interest in delivering great solutions.
* You embody a service-oriented mindset, making yourself accessible to your business colleagues. Recognizing that value is substantiated when business needs are met.
* You communicate effortlessly both verbally and in writing with colleagues and external parties within completely different domains/areas of expertise.
* You possess the ability to analyze and break down a bigger problem into smaller, graspable parts.
* You appreciate the importance of understanding and connecting with the organization's mission, goals, and strategies.

**Qualifications we look** **for**

* An academic degree in computer science, data science or a related field, or equivalent practical experience

**Tech knowledge** **and experience we appreciate**

* Development experience from event driven microservice environments using RESTful APIs
* Kotlin and Spring Boot in containerized environments
* Message-broker platforms like RabbitMQ or similar.
* Automated software building, testing and deployment using GitLab CI/CD
* Infrastructure as Code using Terraform
* Hands on experience working with Kubernetes clusters or similar
* Hands on experience working with AWS S3, Snowflake and dbt or similar
* Professional experience with IIoT environments and protocols like OPC UA and PROFINET

In our agile environment, every team requires a dedicated agile servant to unlock its full potential. If you're passionate about fostering team efficiency and collaboration, you may also be an ideal scrum master.


**What we can offer you**


* The opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology
* A chance to make a real impact on the world
* A collaborative and supportive work environment

If you're fueled by passion and eager to thrive in a diverse range of domains seamlessly connected by a dynamic microservice environment, we invite you to apply and be part of the excitement!



You will get the opportunity to shape your future career together with a company focusing on creating a culture where everyone can thrive and feel a sense of belonging. In the end, we know that Stegra’s growth and success is dependent on our people and we can’t wait to shape the future of steelmaking and other industries together as a team.

description:

But this is just the beginning – our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize other industries in addition to steel, and we look forward to what’s next in store for us.

 **Software Developer - Data Engineer**


At Stegra Digital we believe in business truthfulness and accordingly work in business aligned cross functional teams. Our teams work with operations *and* development over the whole digital technology stack: integrations, operations, analytical data, analysis and frontend. We want you and your teammates to grow outside your respective areas of expertise to solve business’ challenges as they occur.


We are looking for a Software Developer with Data Engineer expertise who is a passionate believer in data mesh principles and wants to build a truly data-driven organization. You and your team are jointly responsibility for your domain’s digital infrastructure and the development and life cycle of the operational and analytical digital solutions. Given your expertise, you’ll be integral in designing, developing, and maintaining our data infrastructure, with a focus on enabling data autonomy and ownership across our business. You'll collaborate closely with peers and domain experts to comprehend the business’ data requirements, developing tailored solutions to meet those needs. Additionally, you'll play a key role in crafting and upkeeping our data governance policies and procedures.


This position is based in Stockholm and is part of Stegra's Digital Team.  

  



Applications will be reviewed from 5th of August.

**About seniority**


We are actively seeking Software Developers with data engineer experience with varying levels of expertise, ranging from recent university graduates to seasoned professionals. The level of seniority you bring will correspond to the qualifications and experiences outlined below, with more senior candidates expected to possess a broader spectrum of these attributes.


**Some soft qualities we value.**

* You are curious about new things, but always balancing new ideas towards existing wisdom.
* You appreciate diverse viewpoints when tackling challenges yet understands the significance of reaching a consensus and adhering to the established pattern for effective collaboration.
* You are passionate about what you are doing and have a genuine interest in delivering great solutions.
* You embody a service-oriented mindset, making yourself accessible to your business colleagues. Recognizing that value is substantiated when business needs are met.
* You communicate effortlessly both verbally and in writing with colleagues and external parties within completely different domains/areas of expertise.
* You possess the ability to analyze and break down a bigger problem into smaller, graspable parts.
* You appreciate the importance of understanding and connecting with the organization's mission, goals, and strategies.

**Qualifications** **we look for**

* An academic degree in computer science, data science or a related field, or equivalent practical experience

**Tech knowledge and experience we appreciate**

* Proven experience as a data engineer
* Professional experience within data engineering principles and best practices
* Experience with data mesh
* Hands on experience working with AWS S3, Snowflake and dbt or similar.
* Experience working with streaming data (e.g. Apache Kafka or similar).
* Kotlin and Spring Boot in containerized environments
* Automated software building, testing, deployment and operations using GitLab CI/CD
* Infrastructure as Code using Terraform
* Experience working with Kubernetes clusters or similar
* Experience developing and operating microservice based environments

In our agile environment, every team requires a dedicated agile servant to unlock its full potential. If you're passionate about fostering team efficiency and collaboration, you may also be an ideal scrum master.


**What we can offer you**


* The opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology
* A chance to make a real impact in the world
* A collaborative and supportive work environment

If you are passionate about data mesh and aspire to play a pivotal role in building a data-driven organization, we welcome and encourage you to apply!

  

You will get the opportunity to shape your future career together with a company focusing on creating a culture where everyone can thrive and feel a sense of belonging. In the end, we know that Stegra’s growth and success is dependent on our people and we can’t wait to shape the future of steelmaking and other industries together as a team.

title: Software Engineer 6 Months Contract
description:
**Position Overview:**
 Belmont Lavan Ltd is offering a 6-month contract for a Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will work on developing high-quality software solutions and contribute to various projects, ensuring they meet both client and internal standards.
