title: Associate Principal Scientist - Process Analytical Technology (Continuous manufacturing - OSD)
description:
**Associate Principal Scientist - Process Analytical Technology**
**Location:** 
 Macclesfield (UK),
   

  

 Embrace an exciting opportunity to build a long-term, varied career in our fast-paced, growing environment. As an Associate Principal Scientist, you will be a key player in supporting the transformation of AZ commercial manufacturing through continuous direct compression (CDC) for OSDs. Your expertise in PAT, analytical science and technologies will be crucial in providing leadership and ensuring efficient support to internal and external manufacturing sites and testing laboratories located in multiple countries.
   

  

 Your role will involve providing PAT expertise in close collaboration with PT&D development teams, manufacturing sites and external organisations. You will be responsible for supporting technology transfer and validation of PAT methods and technologies for commercial manufacturing processes. You will also provide expert support to PAT methods and technologies across the commercial lifecycle of drug products, ensuring they remain fit for purpose and in compliance with evolving regulatory requirements. You will help PT&D and manufacturing sites to develop “cutting edge” science applications in PAT to support the implementation and maintenance of enhanced control strategies for drug products.
   

  

**Essential Skills/Experience:**
* MSc or PhD degree in a relevant subject area with proven experience in the use of PAT in the Pharmaceutical or Chemical industries and/or postgraduate experience in Academia with a PAT industrial focus.
* Scientific leadership skills, the ability to deliver robust scientific contributions to projects and demonstration of using risk-based approaches for successful delivery.
* Proven track record to think and operate across functional boundaries, challenge the status quo and seek opportunities for business improvement.
* Effective influencing and prioritization skills to ensure project delivery to deadlines.
* Good communication and stakeholder management skills, and the ability to discuss complex ideas in a simple, easy to understand manner.
* A good understanding of the overall drug development and commercialization process from development, launch and through life cycle management
* A strong understanding of key process analytical technologies, especially NIR, Raman and microwave resonance spectroscopy
* Demonstrated expertise in PAT method development, implementation, optimization and use of Multi-variate data analysis/ Chemometrics (MVDA, PCA, PLS)
* Good understanding of theoretical and experimental approaches to advance the development and application of enhanced control strategies supporting RTR opportunities
* Experience in issue investigation and change assessment from analytical point of view. Good knowledge of standard tools for root cause analysis (5 whys, PPS, Level 0, etc.)
* Knowledge of the principles and management of Safety, Health & Environment (SHE)
* Business acumen and capability to understand business cases in subject matter areas.


**Desirable Skills/Experience:**
* Work experience in the Pharmaceutical industry in a PAT based role
* Experience in or exposure to multiple subject areas in CMC and related functions (e.g. product development, on-market support, manufacturing and testing)
* An understanding of other key analytical techniques such as separation science, NMR and mass spectrometry
* Previous experience and training in Lean, problem solving tools and experience in data analysis and interpretation


 When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That’s why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. But that doesn't mean we’re not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.
   

  

**Why AstraZeneca?**
 In Operations, we have a big ambition to deliver more medicines to patients, quicker and more affordably. Backed by the investment, leadership and a clear plan to get there, we bring personal dedication and out of the box thinking. We are driven by our commitment to deliver accelerated growth for AstraZeneca and to make people's lives better. It pushes us to keep building on our foundations and progressing as we turn our ever-growing and increasingly complex pipeline from molecule to medicine. Be part of evolving how we work with Lean, cutting-edge science, digitalisation and sustainable practices.
   

  

 Ready to make a positive impact in a team where it means more? Apply now!

title: Sustainability Project Manager
description:
**About Us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

**Some of the Things You’ll Do**
 Sustainability is at core of Instabee´s business model and we drive it as an integral part of our company vision and strategy. We are now looking for a strong Sustainability Project Lead that can lead our big impact projects as well as setting up policies, structures and processes to ensure we lead the way in the industry. We have ambitious targets so your responsibilities will be broad, and who knows what cool projects we will take on next.
   

  

**Examples Of Responsibilities & Tasks**
* Project lead big impact projects (e.g. electrification strategy in our markets and electrification of fleet, alternative production methods for lockers to reduce carbon footprint)
* Improve and develop audit processes for suppliers
* Improve and develop policies, guidelines and processes within sustainability (including social and governance parts)
* Lead Instabee´s sustainability community with champions
* Ensuring CSRD alignment (and future upcoming regulations)
* Benchmark analysis


**Your Future Team**
 You will be part of the Global Sustainability team at Instabee, but you will also work very closely with our Operations and other parts of the organization since we believe that is the way to achieve impact. You will report to the Sustainability Director and work closely together with our senior Sustainability Controller & Environmental Specialist.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
* Solid experience in project management (preferably related to sustainability), with a track record of successfully leading and implementing large and/or complex projects.
* Strong interest in sustainability and experience from working with sustainability. either within consulting or in a business environment.
* Experience of driving projects in an agile tech environment, with a deep understanding of what makes projects and work streams successful.
* Self-driven, used to drive your own work, identifying issues and solving them.
* Strong interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to collaborate with all levels within an organization and understanding business priorities.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, working collaboratively to achieve shared goals.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, ensuring effective communication. Beneficial with fluency in Swedish.
* University education in a relevant area.
* Analytical skills with the ability to gather, interpret, and present data effectively.
* Solid understanding of project management methodologies, tools, and best practices.
* You probably have several years of experience within management / strategy consulting with sustainability focus and additional experience of working in a scale-up / start-up environment.


**If this is you, then we can’t wait to meet you!**
**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this,
 **we can also offer:**
 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
   

  

 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
   

  

 🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town.
   

  

 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
   

  

 ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
   

  

 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care
   

  

 and love to your little one.
   

  

 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.*
 Instabee was founded in 2022 after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee is present in six countries, serving thousands of online merchants, including ASOS, Zalando, Inditex and H&M and is on track to become the most admired European e-commerce enabler.
   

  

 Since the start, Instabee has focused on consumer-centric and sustainable solutions, offering deliveries to boxes and homes using muscle power, electricity, renewable diesel and biofuels. Through bespoke technical solutions, Instabee can guarantee optimal fill rates and routing, minimising any unnecessary transports. Instabee is backed by Kinnevik, Creades and EQT, among others.

title: Sales Representative
description:
**At Ayvens, progress starts with you.**
 Our ambitions to shape the future of sustainable mobility are powered by our talent. Join us, and get better with every move.
   

  

 Sales Representative
   

  

*ALD söker en Sales Representative med ett starkt engagemang och som drivs av att göra nya affärer. Som en del av vårt New Sales team är du drivande i att proaktivt teckna nya affärer med både internationella och lokala företagskunder* 
*.*
 Du trivs med att arbeta självständigt, tar stort ägarskap för att generera nya affärer och nå uppsatta mål. Samtidigt som du bidrar till en positiv stämning inom teamet och till teamets övergripande mål.
   

  

 Du är en god relationsskapare som är bekväm vid förhandlingsbordet och i dialog med beslutsfattare på ledningsgruppsnivå. En förutsättning är också att du tillämpar ett proaktivt arbetssätt, är strukturerad och har en administrativ ådra.
   

  

 Utöver detta är du en trovärdig rådgivare med ett starkt kundfokus, som trivs i en snabbföränderlig miljö med högt tempo.
   

  

 I rollen som Sales Representative arbetar du bland annat med
 **:**
* Generera leads för nya affärer.
* Förbereda anbud inkl. upphandlingar, prissättning, beräkningar och kontakt med leverantörer.
* Prospektmöten (fysiskt & digitalt) inkl. strukturerad uppföljning.
* Delta i kund, leverantörs- och branschevent.
* Föra strukturerade mötesprotokoll med tydliga nästa steg.
* Regelbunden uppdatering av pipeline i Salesforce.
* Ansvar för ”first line of defence” kopplat till kreditrisk på nya kunder (KYC).
* Förbereda kreditansökningar.
* Förbereda ramavtal för nya kunder.
* Förhandling och signering av nya ramavtal.
* Övergripande ansvar för implementation av nya kunder i enlighet med ramavtalet.
* Utveckling av våra produkter och erbjudanden i enlighet med företagets strategi.
* Bidra till att teamet och företaget når sina gemensamma mål genom ”knowledge sharing”, win-rooms, interna projekt och liknande uppgifter.


**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Relevant akademisk bakgrund eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Minst fem års arbetslivserfarenhet av komplex tjänsteförsäljning B2B.
* Mycket god, och dokumenterad, förhandlingserfarenhet.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska (både tal och skrift).
* Körkort.


**Övrig Information**
* Typ av anställning: Heltid
* Plats: Solna
* Startdatum: Omgående


*Urval kommer ske löpande så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan, tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Din ansökan kommer endast att hanteras av rekryterande chef och HR. Vid frågor om tjänsten, tveka inte att höra av dig till Rekryterande chef, Johan Hedström,* 
*johan.hedstrom@leaseplan.com*
**Why Ayvens?**
 With over 3.3 million vehicles managed across more than 44 countries, we provide full-service leasing, flexible subscription services, fleet management services and multi-mobility solutions to customers of all sizes, including large corporates, SMEs, professionals, and private individuals. By leveraging our unique position to lead the way to net zero and further shape the digital transformation of the industry, we are well-positioned to meet the evolving mobility needs of our clients and provide them with the solutions they need to thrive.
   

  

 At Ayvens, we believe that our success is driven by our commitment to customer satisfaction. Our team is dedicated to delivering innovative solutions and technology-enabled services that help our customers focus on their everyday business. We’re committed to sustainable mobility and have made it a core part of our strategy. In everything we do, we’re guided by the principles of authenticity, curiosity, commitment and collaboration. We aim to foster an organisation that's diverse in people and ideas, where everyone can thrive and be themselves, no matter who they are.
   

  

 Join us on this exciting journey as we continue to enable the transformation towards large scale adoption of sustainable mobility and provide our customers with the solutions they need to succeed. Follow our page for the latest updates, news, and insights.
   

  

 \*ALD Automotive | LeasePlan are rebranding to Ayvens across all 44 countries by 2025.

title: Senior Project Controls Manager - Life Science
description:
**Overview**
 As a
 **Senior Project Controls Manager** 
 at Linesight, you will work with highly experienced, culturally diverse, and passionate teams nurturing a strong social dynamic and a shared sense of achievement. You will gain vast industry experience that will open doors for you, extend your skillset and expand your perspective. We will empower, support, and enable you to take real responsibility in your role so that you can take charge of your career progression with us. You will be mentored and supported by industry leaders and given the tools to grow. You will also be involved in and contribute to our business strategy as we continue to evolve. For us lasting trusted relationships are everything, both with our teams and our clients.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
**In This Role You Will**
* Assess engineer and contractor bids, change notices and costs to ensure best value for clients
* Effectively manage and monitor project schedules and cash flow
* Foster top performance and growth for your employees via excellent mentorship and leadership
* Oversee the capital planning process for new projects
* Prepare owner estimates and lead estimate review meetings
* Update key partners with monthly executive and project status reports, project schedule updates, and project risks


**We Would Love To Hear From You If You**
* Are skilled at distilling project data into concise updates enabling rapid and informed decisions
* Have successfully performed project controls roles including cost control, scheduling and estimating
* Have a degree or comparable experience in a construction related discipline
* Have a passion for building your global team and developing and encouraging your employees


**About Us**
 Linesight is a highly successful global project and cost management consultancy that keeps clients coming back. And for that we have our people to thank. You see we’re not like the others. We’re different. Unique. It’s our fresh thinking and focus on what matters that has led to our evolving. We are on a journey working in some of the most exciting innovative sectors with some of the world’s most prestigious companies delivering major projects that deliver a more sustainable built environment. We have an open culture and a flat structure where you can expect to be treated with genuine care, respect, and empathy. With Linesight, you can truly discover the power of team!
   

  

 Diversity, inclusion and accessibility
   

  

 Linesight is committed to transparent, equal opportunity employment practices. We are building a diverse and inclusive organisation, accessible to all, based on having a safe culture which enables all our people to be their true selves. We are a people business, and we understand that the more inclusive we are, the happier our people and better our work will be. We will ensure that individuals with disability are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the application or recruitment process and are accommodated in the workplace. If you require assistance or accommodation of any kind, please mention this in your application, we would love to hear from you!

title: Medical Engagement Lead AT1D (FBM)
description:
**Medical Engagement Lead AT1D**
* Location: Stockholm, Sweden


**About The Job**
 At Sanofi, we’ve redefined diabetes care many times since 1923. Now we’re at the forefront of a new era, redefining the healthcare landscape for people developing autoimmune Type 1 Diabetes (aT1D) with a first-in-class treatment. If you’re passionate about shaping the future of diabetes care for thousands of people around the world, this is your opportunity to become part of our biggest innovation yet in Sanofi’s aT1D team in Sweden.
   

  

 We are an innovative global healthcare company with a focus on immunology that extends to innovation in diabetes and transplant medicine. Across different countries, our talented teams are determined to deliver a best-in-class customer experience using the best of digital, artificial intelligence and personal know-how. With a focus on immunology that extends to innovation in diabetes and transplant medicines, we pursue progress to make a real impact on millions of patients around the world.
   

  

**Main responsibilities:**
* Defining engagement strategy for main key accounts (e.g., Centers of Excellence) and building partnerships with external experts from these accounts (e.g., KOLs) to ensure execution of the Glocal Medical strategy, incl. screening and monitoring
* Co-leading the screening and monitoring strategy at regional level (where relevant) by supporting key decision-makers (e.g., KOLs in Centers of Excellence, regional payers, etc.) in implementing screening and monitoring initiatives (e.g., screening programs to identify people at-risk of T1D, registries to follow patients’ progression through different stages of T1D)
* Mapping of key scientific external experts and societies (incl. KOLs/DOLs, endos, PAGs in partnership with Public Affairs) to inform the development of a local multi-factorial stakeholder engagement strategy
* Supporting the localization of global content and medical messaging tailored to each CoE stakeholders (when appropriate) by leveraging Medical Field input (e.g., on current practice, treatment landscapes, emerging clinical data, etc.)
* Identifying opportunities and/or supporting medical publications (if relevant)
* Serving as a scientific contact person and providing scientific and medical education to internal stakeholders (when requested)
* Working with cross-functional team to leverage an omnichannel approach in the engagement with Centers of Excellence external experts (e.g., KOLs) and orchestrate a high-touch engagement across different innovative channels (e.g., social media, peer-to-peer communities, websites, online portals, etc.), tailored to different segments


**Experience**
*About you*
* industry experience in Medical Affairs
* Deep understanding of Type 1 Diabetes therapy area and/or immunology (prior experience in type 1 diabetes is desired)
* Clear understanding of medical practice, clinical decision-making and healthcare systems related to patient care in Type I Diabetes or Immunology
* Knowledge of relevant healthcare systems, evolving medical landscape, regulatory and payer environment, public health, and industry trends


**Soft And Technical Skills**
* Strategic and analytical thinking capabilities, with ability to disrupt status quo with innovation while remaining pragmatic
* Ability to develop, with cross-functional teams, a local multi-factorial stakeholder engagement strategy for a broad stakeholder ecosystem by understanding how they impact each other
* Highly skilled at executing medical strategies
* Ability to leverage an omnichannel approach in the engagement with external experts to orchestrate a high-touch & personalized engagement based on their level of maturity and preferences
* Ability to develop and convey a simple yet compelling value narrative to a broad set of stakeholders


**Education**
* Ideally MD, PharmD, PhD with research background


**Languages**
* Strong communication and presentation skills in English and local language both written and verbal


*Why choose us?*
* Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team
* Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally
* Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact
* Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs


**Pursue
 *Progress* 
 . Discover
 *Extraordinary* 
 .**
 Progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let’s pursue progress. And let’s discover extraordinary together.
   

  

 At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.
   

  

 Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!
   

  

 Pursue
 *progress* 
 , discover
 *extraordinary*
 Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.
   

  

 At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, ability or gender identity.
   

  

 Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

title: MTA Sales Engineer Scandinavia
description:
At Trane Technologies™ and through our businesses including Trane® and Thermo King®, we create innovative climate solutions for buildings, homes, and transportation that challenge what’s possible for a sustainable world. We're a team that dares to look at the world's challenges and see impactful possibilities. We believe in a better future when we uplift others and enable our people to thrive at work and at home. We boldly go.
   

  

**MTA** 
 , part of
 **Trane Technologies** 
 group, is a manufacturer of equipment for process cooling, industrial refrigeration and compressed air treatment. With its network of official representatives it has presence in over 80 countries throughout the world.
   

  

 As part of our company's development, we are looking for a
 **Sales Engineer** 
 responsible for the introduction and deployment of the process/unitary business in Scandinavia. Reporting to the Country Leader of Sweden, Denmark, and Norway you will be responsible for developing strong customer relationships, maximizing account share, and ensuring customer retention. The role is remote within
 **Sweden or Denmark** 
 with the possibility of working from Trane's office in Stockholm.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Provide effective HVAC-related solutions to customer problems, considering financial and performance-based factors.
* Identify customer needs and market opportunities, coordinating acquisition teams when necessary.

* Develop and execute account-specific business plans to foster strong, profitable partnerships.

title: Norsktalande kundtjänstmedarbetare till kund i Spånga
description:
**Om rollen**
 I rollen som norsktalande kundtjänstmedarbetare kommer dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter att innebära att ta hand om kunder på den norska marknaden och deras operativa frågor. Rollen innebär också hantering av orderprocessen och fakturering. Utöver kundkontakt kommer du även att ha kontakt med interna och externa återförsäljare.
   

  

 I din roll som Norsktalande kundtjänstmedarbetare kommer dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter innebära:
   

  

  

* Ta hand om operativa frågor från kunder
* Kontakta kunder och återförsäljare internt och externt
* Fakturering och orderregistrering samt hantering
* Lägga upp nya kunder
* Bemanna telefonväxel och generell mailbox
* Ge support och backup för kundreklamationer
* Kontinuerligt förbättra logiken i konfiguratorn
* Administrera Klarna och InExchange (e-fakturahantering)


 Tjänsten som Norsktalande kundtjänstmedarbetare är ett konsultuppdrag med start under oktober/november och med god chans till förlängning eller övertag.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har tidigare erfarenhet inom kundservice. Det är också viktigt att vara flytande i norska och engelska för att klara av tjänsten. Erfarenhet inom med tech är meriterande. Vi ser gärna att du har en relevant avklarad utbildning på gymnasienivå eller högre. Erfarenhet av affärssystem så som Visma eller Monitor är också ett plus.
   

  

 Vidare ser vi att du är kommunikativ och har en god förmåga att skapa relationer. För att trivas i den här rollen är det bra om du trivs i en miljö med ett högt tempo. Vi tror också att det är bra att du har ett intresse för service, teknik och administration.
   

  

 Viktigt för tjänsten är:
   

  

  

* Erfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter
* Flytande i Norska och Engelska
* Relevant avklarad utbildning
* Goda administrativa kunskaper
* Tekniska kunskaper eller kunskaper inom affärssystem


 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Kontaktuppgifter**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare: Fanny Sandegren via fanny.sandegren@adecco.se
   

  

 Har du frågor angående registrering, var god kontakta supporten via info@adecco.se
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Sökord**
 Innesäljare, kundservice, orderhantering, administration, fakturering, e-fakturahantering, Visma, Monitor, teknisk support, konsultuppdrag, kundrelationer, ekonomi, IT-system.

title: PROMOTER FOR SHARKNINJA IN SWEDEN
description:
Workshop is now looking for Promoters for SharkNinja. Are you passionate about sales, interested in technical solutions and home electronics, love running sales in store and are you fearless and goal-oriented? Then you can be our new Promoter!
   

  

**About the role:**
 In the role as a Promoter you will, among other things, market and demonstrate their products while acting as an ambassador for the brand. SharkNinja manufactures innovative household products that combine advanced technology and user-friendly design to make everything from cleaning and cooking both easier and more efficient. You will work in a store and the focus will be on giving customers an experience out of the ordinary. Therefore, it is important that you contribute to a top-class customer experience by gaining broad knowledge of the products and having a positive attitude. In order for you to succeed in this, we will offer you training in sales, service and in SharkNinjas products.
   

  

**Who you are:**
 As a person, you are outgoing, energetic and love meeting new people. You enjoy working in a team as well as individually. We believe that you as a Promoter are a person who is considered to be both a social genius and technically adaptable.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, you must meet the following criteria:**
* Has experience in sales and/or customer service
* Is positive, driven and social
* You are positive, motivated and social
* You find it easy to spread happiness and create relationships
* You have a keen interest in retail


 Of course, we value experience in similar work highly, but we think it is even more important that you have a high level of ambition and are passionate about developing and creating successful customer meetings.
   

  

**Placement** 
 : Sweden
   

  

**Start** 
 : September
   

  

**Employment:** 
 Project based
   

  

**Working hours** 
 : Two to four days per month
   

  

*WorkShop offers you an exciting job in an international and dynamic organization where there is a short time gap from idea to action. Would you like to join us?*
 Selection and interview process is ongoing; therefore, please apply as soon as possible. We don't accept applications by mail, apply therefore via add.
 **Last application day is 2024-09-02.**
 Learn more about our company at work-shop.com and follow us on Facebook, LinkedIn and Instagram!

title: Resande Mekaniker Mitt i Sverige
description:
**Om jobbet**
 Alfa Laval Nordic, vårt nordiska försäljningsbolag, söker en erfaren mekaniker med intresse för att hjälpa kunder genom proffsigt bemötande och hög servicenivå.
   

  

 I dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter ingår att utföra service, både major och intermediate, på kundens maskiner samt att åtgärda akuta problem. Felsökning och att ständigt jobba med maskinoptimering och förbättring av processerna ingår också. Allt arbete utförs huvudsakligen hos våra kunder i Sverige.
   

  

 Utöver detta innefattar tjänsten att se till att god ordning råder inom arbetsområdet för att förebygga olycksfall/ohälsa samt att skapa trivsel och gott arbetsklimat.
   

  

 Till din hjälp har du ett väl uppbyggt nätverk av kollegor som ger dig den support och stöttning som du behöver. Som ny hos oss välkomnas du med ett introduktionsprogram av utbildningar, en handledare som ger dig vägledning och trevliga kollegor. Teamet i är idag en grupp på 15 personer i Sverige/ Finland och 42 personer totalt i Nordic där samarbete inom teamet sker på daglig basis.
   

  

**Förväntade övernattningar är cirka 100–125 per år och du utgår från ditt hem i mittsverige, men är formellt anställd på Alfa Laval Nordic i Tumba. Ditt ansvarsområde är hela Sverige, men med fokus på den centrala delen av landet.**
**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Utföra planerade serviceåtgärder på maskinerna.
* Följa upp allt arbete hos kunderna och bidra till hög servicenivå.
* Felsöka och snabbt lösa tekniska problem på plats hos kunderna genom att diagnostisera, ge lösningsförslag och föreslå förbättringsåtgärder.
* Utforma servicerapporter på plats i samarbete med kunderna.
* Upprätthålla korrekt och uppdaterad information i IT-systemet.
* Identifiera och rapportera osäkra metoder och incidenter, vilket bidrar till ständiga förbättringar.
* Identifiera försäljningsmöjligheter genom att samarbeta med säljteamet.
* Ge proaktiv servicerådgivning till kunder från vår 360-tjänstportfölj.


**Du Kan Läsa Mer Om Produkterna Här**
 Dekanteringscentrifuger | Alfa Laval
   

  

 Centrifugal separators | Separation equipment | Alfa Laval
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att avståndet mellan dig och de flesta av våra kunder inte ska bli för långt ser vi helst att du är bosatt i Värmland, Örebro, Västmanland, Södermanland, Uppsala eller Stockholms län. Norra delarna av Östergötland, Västra Götaland samt södra delarna av Dalarnas och Gävleborg kan också vara aktuella. Som person är du driven, social och har lätt att prata med nya personer och du är van vid att ta ansvar för ditt arbete. Du är noggrann och nöjer dig inte med något annat än ett perfekt utfört jobb och du ser tekniska problem som en rolig och spännande utmaning. Du har erfarenhet från att arbeta ute på fältet med kunder eller så är du nyfiken på att prova på fältarbete.
   

  

* Du har en teknisk bakgrund och goda mekaniska färdigheter, gärna från maritim eller tunga fordon/utrustning.
* Du trivs med ett rörligt och skiftande arbetstempo med mycket frihet under ansvar.
* Innehav av giltigt körkort är en förutsättning för denna roll då du åker ut till kundernas anläggningar för att utföra arbetet.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska är ett krav för att kunna kommunicera med våra kunder och du kan också göra dig förstådd på engelska.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av separatorer och dekanter är meriterande men Alfa Laval kommer att utbilda dig i alla produkter.


**Om du inte uppfyller allt ovan, men en del, uppmuntrar vi dig att söka tjänsten ändå. Låt oss tillsammans ta reda på om vi passar ihop!**
**Vad finns det för möjligheter för dig?**
 Vi erbjuder en utmanande position i en öppen och vänlig miljö där vi hjälper varandra att utveckla och skapa värde. Ditt arbete kommer att ha en inverkan på Alfa Lavals framtida framgång.
   

  

**Vi Erbjuder Även**
* Konkurrenskraftig ersättning och förmånspaket
* Servicebil
* Stora utvecklingsmöjligheter – Vi uppmuntrar intern rörlighet, när det är möjligt
* Utmärkt arbetsmiljö – säkerhet och etik är verkligen viktigt för oss
* Lärande & Utveckling - Vi investerar i våra medarbetare på lång sikt – inte bara med lön och förmåner, utan med kontinuerliga möjligheter till lärande och utveckling.


**För mer information, kontakta gärna**
 Geir Lærum, Country Manager Field Service Sverige & Finland, Tel 0732 305 057
   

  

 Anna Åhlin, Talent Acquisition Partner, anna.ahlin@alfalaval.com
   

  

**Union information**
 IF Metall: Emil Höök, Emil.hook@alfalaval.com
   

  

 Unionen: Anders Jansson, anders.jansson@alfalaval.com
   

  

**Urval sker löpande så vänligen vänta inte med din ansökan. Sista dag att söka är 30:e september 2024.**
**Vi tar inte emot ansökningar som skickas direkt via e-post.**
 Vi bryr oss om mångfald, inkludering och rättvisa i våra rekryteringsprocesser. Vi tror också att beteendeegenskaper kan ge viktig information om hur bra en kandidat passar i en roll. För att hjälpa oss att uppnå detta tillämpar vi Pymetrics spel. Efter att du sökt rollen kommer du att bli inbjuden att spela bedömningsspelen.

title: HR Operations Lead - Nordics (maternity cover)
description:
**This is where you save and sustain lives**
 At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.
   

  

 Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.
   

  

 Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.
   

  

 Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission.
   

  

**Summary**
 We are looking for an HR Operations Lead for a period of 10 months to join a highly engaged and competent HR team. This is a great opportunity for you that would like to make a difference in an organization which has started an exciting new chapter. You can be based in Kista. You will focus on various HR tasks and projects, while mainly driving an efficient and high performing HR operations.
   

  

 The team is located in our four Nordic countries, and you will report directly to the HR Manager for the Nordics.
   

  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**
* Implements HR plans and strategies to support the achievement of business objectives and of desired organizational design/culture.
* Gives general support in all areas of the employee lifecycle from recruitment, performance, and development through to leavers e.g., coaching managers, supporting HRBP.
* Supports the revision and development of policies and processes as directed.
* Lead of the yearly salary revision process including e.g., salary mapping, union negotiations, global and local process.
* Support payroll coordination with external partner
* Lead on Compensation and Benefits e.g., data collection and reporting to external parties when it comes to salary, pension, insurances.
* Data management SME (Workday)
* Develop and maintain strong working partnership with key stakeholders in global, regional cluster and local level.
* Acts as an active member of the Nordic HR team to collaborate on Nordic HR projects and tasks.


**Qualifications**
* 2-3 years of experience in a similar role
* Fluent English, both oral and written, fluent Swedish or any other Scandinavian language will be an asset.
* Interest and background in compensation and benefits (pension, insurances, salary etc.).
* Interest and background in one or more Nordic countries legal landscape
* Strong skills in Excel and power point
* Interest and background in working with systems, data, reporting (Workday experience is a benefit)
* Structured and organized.
* Team player and highly collaborative
* Highly independent/taking accountability.
* Pragmatic
* Works with speed while paying close attention to detail.


**What we can offer**
 Collaboration plays a vital part in this role, and as one of our culture levers, the team actively and intentionally works across the organization to deliver results. We focus on work-life balance and hope you do too!
   

  

 At Baxter, as an HR Operations Lead, you will get a good benefits package including competitive salary, pension, insurance, and sports contribution.
   

  

 If you like the sound of the above role, can thrive in a fast-paced working environment, are excited about working in a learning and growth culture, and feel this is a place where you can thrive, we'd love to talk to you. Apply here today.
   

  

**Reasonable Accommodations**

 Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.
   

  


**Recruitment Fraud Notice**

 Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

title: Staff Software Engineer – JVM/Rust Expert (Bangkok-based, Full Relocation Package Provided)
description:
****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Get to know our team – Observability Platform in Agoda**
 Within the WhiteFalcon team, we build and maintain Agoda’s time series database and log aggregation system. We process tens of millions of measurements per second and hundreds of terabytes of logs per day in multiple datacenters, powering thousands of dashboards and alerts. Our biggest challenges are to support the ever-growing need for collecting more data, faster and at lower cost.
   

  

**In This Role, You’ll Get to**
* Build fault-tolerant, horizontally scalable solutions running in multi-tenant environments
* Solve challenging problems in distributed and highly concurrent environment
* Impact all developers in Agoda, providing better observability instruments


****What You’ll Need To Succeed****
* At least 8 years of experience writing performant and scalable code using JVM (Java/Scala/Kotlin) or Rust (C++) languages
* User/dev experience of one of the following products: Prometheus, InfluxDB, Victoria Metrics, Elasticsearch, Grafana Loki
* Production experience with messaging queues (Kafka)
* Deep understanding of concurrency and multithreading
* Value code simplicity and performance
* Demonstrate proficiency in communication and collaboration skill


**It’s Great If You Have**
* Strong background in DB internals, indexes, data formats (AVRO, Protobuf)
* You generally understand observability data types, such as logs and metrics
* Profilers, debuggers, tracers hide no secrets from you, especially in a Linux environment
* Experience building large-scale time series data stores and monitoring solutions
* Experience with S3 (Ceph), Elasticsearch, Grafana and other open-source components
* You can get down to the low-level when needed


 #sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #denver #miami #orlando #atlanta #chicago #boston #detroit #newyork #portland #philadelphia #dallas #houston #austin #seattle #sydney #melbourne #perth #toronto #vancouver #montreal #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #prague #Brno #Ostrava #estonia #paris #berlin #munich #hamburg #stuttgart #cologne #frankfurt #dusseldorf #dortmund #essen #Bremen #leipzig #dresden #hanover #nuremberg #athens #hongkong #budapest #jakarta #bali #dublin #telaviv #jerusalem #milan #rome #venice #florence #naples #turin #palermo #bologna #tokyo #osaka #yokohama #nagoya #okinawa #fukuoka #sapporo #kualalumpur #malta #amsterdam #oslo #manila #warsaw #krakow #bucharest #doha #alrayyan #moscow #saintpetersburg #singapore #seoul #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #tainan #taichung #kaohsiung #bangkok #Phuket #istanbul #dubai #abudhabi #sharjah #london #manchester #edinburgh #kiev #hcmc #hanoi #amsterdam #bucharest #lodz #wroclaw #poznan #katowice #rio #salvador #bandung #yokohama #nagoya #okinawa #fukuoka #IT #ENG #4
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
