title: Supporttekniker
description:
Välkommen till Mitigram – där vi inte bara strävar efter att förändra framtidens globala handelsfinansiering, utan också en plats där dina färdigheter och engagemang kan frodas i en stimulerande arbetsmiljö. Just nu söker vi efter en driven och erfaren Supporttekniker som inte bara är skicklig inom teknisk support, utan också är en social lagspelare som trivs med eget ansvar.
  
Rollen som Supporttekniker innebär inte bara att hantera användarsupport, utan även stötta med ärenden av mer second line karaktär och aktivt delta i drifts- och projektuppgifter. Här kommer du att ha en betydande möjlighet att påverka arbetet genom att utvärdera, se förbättringar och implementera nya lösningar samt att automatisera uppgifter.
  
Mitigram uppmuntrar till personlig utveckling och karriäravancemang. Du kan till exempel utforska spännande möjligheter inom områden som IT Operations eller DevOps. På Mitigram får du chansen att växa och ta nästa steg i din karriär inom den tekniska sfären.
  
Ansvarsområden
  
Underhåll av Mitigrams interna klientmiljö, inklusive datorer, mobila enheter samt tillhörande applikationer och servrar.
  
Hantering av dagliga användarärenden.
  
Onboarding och offboarding av anställda och konsulter, inklusive skapande av användarprofiler, tilldelning av licenser och beställning av hårdvara.
  
Ansvar för automatiserad patchning av enheter.
  
  

Kvalifikationer
  
Tal och skrift flytande engelska samt svenska
  
Högskola/Universitets-utbildning inom relevant område
  
God kunskap med Windows klienter, iPhone och Android mobiler
  
Kunnig i Microsoft Office 365
  
Erfarenhet av Active Directory och Azure
  
Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet
  
Meriterande med kunskaper inom Linux, containers, containerorkestrering (Kubernetes) och scripting
  
  

Vad Mitigram erbjuder
  
Du blir en del av ett internationellt, dynamiskt och växande företag.
  
Du kommer ingå i en rolig, samarbetsvillig och stödjande arbetsmiljö.
  
Du får tillgång till personalförmåner såsom ITP1-pensionsplan, omfattande sjukförsäkring, årlig friskvårdspeng och mer.
  
Arbete i en strukturerad och processdriven organisation, certifierad enligt ISO 27001-standard.
  
  

Referens och bakgrundskontroller
  
Som en del av rekryteringsprocessen på Mitigram kommer du att ombedjas att tillhandahålla ett par referenser som du är eller har haft ett arbetsförhållande med under de senaste 5 åren och vi kan komma att genomföra en bakgrundskontroll.
  
Om Mitigram
  
Handelsfinansiering är avgörande för global handel, och global handel är avgörande för global ekonomisk tillväxt, utveckling och innovation. Mitigram är den ledande digitala plattformen för global handelsfinansiering och är på en resa för att bygga det största och mest omfattande handelsfinansieringsnätverket.
  
Mitigram är ett av de mest spännande fintech-företagen i Norden. Stark tillväxt, bland världens största företag och banker som våra kunder, och ledande investerare säkerställer att vi har många spännande utmaningar och möjligheter för alla som ansluter sig i detta skede.
  
Mitigram har utvecklat en världsledande online-marknadsplats byggd för handelsfinansieringssamhället. Vår produkt är erkänt av tusentals personer världen över, från Montevideo till Shanghai. Vi är det snabbast växande handelsfinansieringsnätverket på marknaden.
  
Handelsfinansiering är själva delen av bankväsendet som stöder biljontals dollar av handel varje år, vilket underlättar affärer mellan köpare och säljare över hela världen. Utan handelsfinansiering skulle världen bokstavligen stå stilla.
  
Mitigram-teamet är mycket mångsidigt med medlemmar från 15+ länder från ledande institutioner inom handel, investering, riskhantering, programvara, säkerhet och efterlevnad.

title: Verification Lead of Cutting-Edge Sensor Systems
description:
*Want to influence the bigger picture? At Saab, you can realise amazing innovations that keep people and societies safe. Together, we can truly make an impact – and your part matters.*


Your role


The next generations of Surveillance sensor systems will continuously evolve to meet our customer’s increasing demands in a fast-changing world. Saab Digital Sensor Core will enable fast insertion of new technology using common building blocks and continuous delivery at high speed for future sensor systems at Surveillance.


We lead the design and development of the Saab’s platform for future sensors in close cooperation with the different development organizations at Business Area Surveillance. The common building blocks will be continuously integrated and verified in our labs and demonstrators.


We now need Integration & Verification lead to:

* Lead the integration and verification of sensor systems comprising of high frequency functions, computer platforms, antenna control and beamforming SW and application SW.
* Secure that requirements, standards and regulations are fulfilled.
* Plan, monitor and perform verification activities.
* Participate in developing an efficient verification strategy for the product.
* As a part of our system team work closely with other design teams to secure efficient solutions.


We offer a stimulating environment with the opportunity to work with experienced colleagues in a variety of different development and customer projects. You will work with complex systems and create efficient technical solutions together with others in a team based agile environment.


Your profile


We are looking for passionate technical leaders who want to be part of our journey building the Saab Digital Sensor Core and contribute to a collaborative work environment with transparency, respect and trust for each other. To thrive in the position, you need to be a team player and have the ability to motivate and engage others.


Experience in the field of integration & verification, CI/CD/DevOps and product development are highly appreciated. Our products cover a wide area of technical disciplines so we expect that you have a degree in either high frequency function, mechanics, software/firmware, signal processing, electronics or computer platforms. You also need excellent communication skills in Swedish and English.

*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*


What you will be a part of


Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.


Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.


Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.


Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Infrastructure architect and Tech lead, Engineering (Full-time)
company: Technology Nexus Secured Business Solutions AB
description:
At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we are shaping the digital future by securing trusted identities for millions around the globe. Our cutting-edge Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms redefine how we trust and interact in a world driven by digital transformation. Do you want to be at the forefront of this technological revolution?
  
We’re looking for an Infrastructure Tech Lead and Architect
  
Henrik Hjelm, Director of Infrastructure, is seeking an experienced, hands-on technical lead to drive the strategic direction of our Infrastructure team in Stockholm. If you have a strong foundation in both public and private cloud environments, a passion for automation, and the expertise to architect secure, scalable infrastructures, this is your opportunity to make a meaningful impact.
  
What We Offer You Lead or team in their day-to-day operations and act as a seniorarchitect to advanced, secure, and scalable infrastructure solutions for global products and clients, impacting millions of users.
  
Join an innovative company driving the "Zero Trust" identity revolution for people and things, in both physical and digital worlds.
  
Be the technical authority for infrastructure strategy, helping the team towards high levels of automation, efficiency, and security.
  
Collaborate closely with product teams and clients to deliver critical infrastructure solutions and services.
  
Continuous professional development in the security, identity, and cloud automation space.
  
What You’ll Do as Infrastructure Tech Lead and Architect Architect, design, and guide the development of secure, scalable, and highly available infrastructure solutions across public, private, and hybrid cloud environments.
  
Ensure alignment between infrastructure architecture, strategic business goals, and client expectations.
  
Help define and drive the technical roadmap for infrastructure automation and optimization using technologies such as Terraform, Ansible, OpenStack, AWS, Azure, and containerization.
  
Lead incident, problem, and change management processes, ensuring the team’s timely and efficient response to operational needs.
  
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure seamless communication and process optimization across teams.
  
Your Expertise A proven track record as an Infrastructure Architect, Infrastructure Engineer, or similar role, with significant experience managing complex, scalable, and secure environments.
  
Expertise in Infrastructure as Code, using tools such as Terraform and Ansible for automation, and extensive knowledge of cloud environments (AWS, Azure) and Linux.
  
A deep understanding of best practices in security, scalability, and cloud-native architectures.
  
Proficient in modern infrastructure tools like Datadog, Azure DevOps Pipelines, and container orchestration platforms.
  
You work independently, driving processes with minimal supervision, while also collaborating and lead theteam to achieve collective success.
  
Qualifications You are senior team member, with a very strong technical acumen and broad knowledge within Infrastructure. You don't need to have previous leader experience, but curious about taking steps towards more leadership roles
  
Many years of experience in infrastructure architecture with a deep technical background in Linux, cloud environments, and automation technologies.
  
A passion for automating infrastructure processes and a desire to work with complex, scalable solutions.
  
Experienced in leading technical project/technical project management
  
Due to customer requirements you need to be unhindered in Swedish (written and spoken) as well a proficient in English.
  
What’s Next? Apply now by uploading your CV in English.
  
The final candidate will undergo a background check to ensure our commitment to transparency, security, and trust.
  
  

At Nexus, we believe in diversity and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to building a workplace where personal experiences and unique perspectives thrive. Join us to innovate and help secure the future in a dynamic and evolving digital world.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
We're looking for DevOps Engineers to join Primea and our consultancy projects, based in either Gothenburg or Stockholm.


We build compelling and complex web applications on a daily basis, utilizing bleeding-edge technologies but make sure that they are proven, reliable and relevant for the problem in question. To best serve our clients and end-users, you'll delve into new concepts every day, and always be looking for new, innovative ways to solve the problems we have at hand. Curiosity, collaboration and willingness to learn will get you far, we are always humble when taking on new challenges, and at the same time eager to get going.


As a DevOps Engineer Consultant at Primea, you will have the privilege to work in a competent, cross-functional team where your contributions will be highly appreciated and important. Since you've been working in a professional setting before, you will fit right into any given team you'll end up in.


As a DevOps Engineer you will be working with creating standards for deployment, monitoring, and logging, and design and implement automation for common operational tasks, wherever possible.

**OUR OFFER TO YOU**

  

* Great colleagues, flexible company and fun projects
* Hackaways - Developer conferences in and outside of Sweden
* Learning opportunities during our knowledge sharing sessions
* Travels to different locations where we have office spaces around the world
* Possibility to become co-founder & shareholder in our spin-off companies
* Competitive salary and benefit package

**YOUR PROFILE**

  

* MSc or Bachelor of Computer Science
* 3+ years as a DevOps Engineer
* Experience of working with Containers Orchestration (Kubernetes or Openshift)
* Experiences from CI/CD tools like Jenkins, or Azure DevOps
* Experience from any cloud provider, Azure, GCP, or AWS - certification is a plus
* Experience in Source control in Git
* Proficiency in at least one high-level scripting language
* Understanding of protocols/technologies like HTTP, SSL, LDAP, SSH, etc.
* Experience from monitoring tools such as Grafana, Prometheus, or similar
* Any experience in Infrastructure Automation like IAC and Terraform is a plus.


Does this sound like something for you? Would you like to join a company where your personal and professional development is in focus? Show us your interest by applying as soon as possible!

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
DevOps is a suporting team providing development support to all development teams within Toptracer. The DevOps team at Toptracer owns, builds, and delivers the central DevOps infrastructure to rest of the development organization. As an engineer in the DevOps team, you will be working with the central parts of the CI/CD process and have an infrastructural responsibility for both our cloud-based environments and our on-premises solutions. Setting up servers, deploying, and maintaining infrastructure for both test and production.
   

  

 You will also have a big impact developing and simplify the deployments process for our team. The role offers 360 degrees of responsibility for the server environments for the collaborating teams to make sure Toptracer continues to deliver moments that matter. The team also maintain our regression and integration environments for our range deployed software.
   

  

 You are a quick learner who enjoys understanding new tech stacks and applying suitable technology to the tasks at hand. You are open-minded and can consider the pros and cons of multiple alternative solutions. You have a passion for CI/CD, coding, problem-solving, and a deep understanding of what a development organisation needs.
   

  

**About Toptracer**
 Toptracer Technologies have users and viewers all over the world. Our mission is to help people enjoy the wonderful game of golf even more by tracing contributions to TV and gamification to ranges. Our range technology is used in 32 countries and the broadcast is aired over 270 times every year. All of our products are developed, tested and deployed from our R&D office in Danderyd, Stockholm.
   

  

**More About Toptracer**
**Workplace**
 We value fully engaged associates that come to work because they enjoy their work and the colleagues they have. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where everybody can reach their full potential. We provide opportunities for all the colleagues to develop internally and to meet each other. We have a strong commitment and dedication at Toptracer. That comes from our activities and moments we share together and the product we are developing. In addition to that, our technology is unique and world-leading which makes the journey extra exciting. We create a product that encourages people to be outside and get activated which enables a healthier lifestyle. As a colleague at Toptracer, you can either go to a range nearby your home to experience the product you have developed or just turn on the TV to see it in the biggest golf tournaments.
   

  

**Culture**
 Our culture is driven by our mission to create moments that matter for everyone and our values for Caring, Courage, One Team, Fun and Excellence. If you want to learn more about them visit: Core Values | Topgolf.
   

  

**Activities**
* Conference
* Cozy-Fika-Fridays
* After-work with live music and games
* Pair/Mob programming
* Dart
* Table-tennis
* Golf simulator in the office
* Golf tournaments


**Benefits** 
 – These are the broader list of benefits and depends on the type of position.
   

  

* Market-based compensation
* Performance bonus
* Private health insurance
* Pension similar to ITP1
* Spring Health - Personalized mental healthcare
* Generous wellness allowance
* 6 weeks’ vacation
* Phone
* Computer
* Courses
* Traveling to ranges and tournaments
* Half-days before public holidays
* Golfing Green Card


**Flexibility**
 We believe in personal responsibility, so we try to accommodate everyone's needs. We have flexible working hours and locations to help our teams do their best work.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Welcome to Alf!** 




 Hi there! We are Alf – a newly formed tech company within Länsförsäkringar Alliance. With a client base of more than 1,8 million households, Länsförsäkringar is one of Sweden’s biggest financial groups. Alf is on a mission to create a secure and sustainable way of living by adding cutting-edge IoT tech to 200+ years of experience from helping customers taking care of their homes. Join our team and make a real impact. Automate, optimize, and secure our Azure cloud as DevOps Engineer!
 



  





**About the job.** 




 As a DevOps Engineer at Alf, you'll drive the efficiency and security of our Azure-based infrastructure. You will work closely with our development teams to optimize our applications and infrastructure, ensuring efficiency and cost-effectiveness. Your role includes building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines, managing cloud resources, and ensuring that our systems meet security requirements.
 



  





 You’ll be hands-on with Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) and terraform, and play a key role in troubleshooting, performance optimization while proactively identifying security risks.
 



  





**Your responsibilities will include:** 



* Implementing and managing Infrastructure as Code (IaC) for Azure resources.
* Developing, implementing, and maintaining CI/CD pipelines to automate build processes and deploy code using Azure DevOps.
* Ensuring our environment meets security requirements by proactively identifying and mitigating risks.
* Overseeing and optimizing cloud resources in Azure.
* Troubleshooting and improving performance of applications and infrastructure.
* Develop monitors and alerts for errors and performance.



  





**About you.** 




 As a seasoned DevOps Engineer, you possess a strong foundation in Azure, Terraform, and CI/CD pipelines. You have hands-on experience with Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) for container orchestration. As an automation enthusiast, you're skilled in streamlining workflows, optimizing performance, and ensuring security in cloud environments. Having experience in DevSecOps, is a huge plus, as security is a vital part of our operations.
 



  





 Technical expertise aside, you are detail-oriented and take pride in anticipating and addressing bottlenecks before they escalate into bigger issues. You work well independently but also thrive in a collaborative, agile team setting, where effective communication is key. Furthermore, you are always eager to learn new technologies and you’re adaptable to changing workflows and challenges.
 



  





**About Alf.** 




 Länsförsäkringar embodies more than 200 years of dedication to create safety for our customers. With Alf, all that experience is being combined with innovative technology to cater the current needs of our clients. It’s a full-service solution providing personalized insights, advice and content, which enables the users to proactively take care of and protect their homes. With Alf and Länsförsäkringar, safety and sustainability go hand in hand.
 



  





 Alf is operated by Länsförsäkringar Trygghetstjänster AB, a company owned by Länsförsäkringar Alliance. This provides a unique opportunity to become part of an engaged and fun team at an innovative tech company, characterised by the agile and dynamic essence of a startup, all while being supported by the stability and strength of Länsförsäkringar Alliance.
 



  





**With Alf and Länsförsäkringar, you will get:** 




  





 🏡 Work-life balance through a hybrid model
 



 🏢 Centrally located office in Stockholm
 



 🤝 Collective agreement including including pension and insurance coverage
 



 🏃 Wellness allowance
 



 💸 Special banking perks
 



 🚀…and more but let us dive more into that when we meet in person
 



  





**How to apply.** 




 Apply by sending us your CV in Swedish or English. Our selection process is continuous, and we may move forward with candidates on an ongoing basis.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är hängivna experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Som DevOps Engineer och konsult hos oss ingår du i DevOps Teamet inom sektionen 'IT Architecture and Advisory'. Teamets uppdrag är att hjälpa olika befintliga och nya kunder att sätta upp sin infrastruktur baserat på projektspecifika behov.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du får möjlighet att arbeta med olika projekt/tekniska lösningar, utforska, designa och bygga arkitektur för olika typer av applikationer hos olika kunder.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Matchar din profil nedan beskrivning?**
 Vi söker någon med nedanstående kunskaper och erfarenheter, men vi tror dock att du kan vara en intressant kandidat även om du inte uppfyller alla kriterier.
   

  

* Erfarenhet med andra publika molnplattformar som Azure, AWS eller/och GCP
* Kunskap inom nätverk, brandväggar och lastbalanserare
* Erfarenhet av containers och molntekniker (t.ex. Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, Azure)
* Applikationsdistributionsarkitektur via Docker och TLS-certifikatshantering för produktionsmiljöer
* Några års praktisk erfarenhet av Azure DevOps (infra), GitLab, Github eller relaterade tjänster.
* Erfarenhet av att designa och utveckla CI/CD-miljöer
* Flera års praktisk erfarenhet av Linux-hantering och skriptning och automation.
* Erfarenheter av att designa, implementera och hantera CI/CD-pipelines på Gitlab, GitHub, Jenkins och Azure
* Erfarenhet av felsökning, t.ex. brandväggsinställningar, serverproblem, trafik mellan servrar
* Arkitekturkunskap om frontend-teknologier, backend-teknologier samt databaser och meddelandelösningar
* God förståelse för DNS, routing, lastbalansering, nätverk och brandväggsteknik
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift


 Vi lägger även stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper som vi tror bland annat kännetecknas av att du är en Team player som tycker om att ta ansvar, kan arbeta självständigt och har ett öga för detaljer.
   

  

**Obs!** 
**Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-10-12.** 
*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tänkas bli tillsatt innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Ytterligare information**
**Vad erbjuder AFRY dig som anställd?**
 Vi har regelbundna träffar där temat varierar mellan kompetens och socialt utbyte, eller både och. En bra balans helt enkelt!
   

  

 Du får du t.ex.:
   

  

* En AFRY Buddy som bollplank under din första tid som anställd
* Vi arbetar aktivt med vår strategi för löpande utveckling för våra konsulter. Detta sker genom kompetensutvecklingsprojekt, seminarier, utbildningar, samarbeten etc.
* Balans i arbetslivet med möjlighet till hybridarbete.
* Tillgång till Club AFRY där en bredd av spännande och underhållande aktiviteter för våra medarbetare anordnas - det finns något för alla! Läs gärna mer här.
* Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner gällande pension, friskvård och föräldraledighet reglerade i vårt kollektivavtal
* Företagsrabatter med externa partners genom vår förmånsportal Advantage You.
* Friskvårdsbidrag 3000 SEK/år.
* Restauranger och kaféer på plats
* Ett enormt nätverk av tekniska experter med +19 000 kollegor runtom i världen.


**Kontaktpersoner för frågor:**
 Aamir Faried, rekryterande chef
   

  

 Aamir.faried@afry.com
   

  

**Om rekryteringsprocessen** 
 :
   

  

 I alla våra rekryteringsprocesser använder vi oss av kompetensbaserad rekrytering - för en rättvis och träffsäker rekrytering.
   

  

* Telefonavstämning eller urvalsfrågor via mejl
* Två intervjusteg (IRL eller via Teams)
* Referenstagning
* Erbjudande


*Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.*
- 

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Senior Cloud Engineer
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 We are currently looking for a Senior Cloud Engineer to join our distributed team in Vattenfall. Our colleagues work from Poland, Germany, Sweden and the Netherlands. We work mostly remotely, but we believe in keeping team spirit alive - that's why we meet on location at least once a year.
   

  

 Also, we meet during our virtual daily stand-ups during which we talk about sprint progress and help each other when needed.
   

  

**What will you do?**
 In the role as cloud engineer you will be working in a team that is very close to business but also to all other IT teams. To succeed in this role it is important that you have the ability to get an T-shaped skill profile. This means be an expert in one or more of the following areas: Network, OS, Backup, Security, Databases, Web but become a generalist on all other areas touched by the cloud. So there is not one person dealing e.g. with Network it is the whole team. Since automation is key for our delivery, you are also expected to have the ability to code and/or script. You need to be open for a fast changing and developing environment which will challenge you every day.
   

  

**Your tasks and responsibilities:**
 As our cloud engineer your major responsible for ensuring a stable cloud platform which is evolving with the needs of the organization. Specific tasks would include:
   

  

* Scripting
* Automation and orchestration, CI/CD with Azure DevOps
* Configuration Management
* OS support
* Governance enforcement
* SaaS/PaaS support
* Cloud Networking
* Security enforcement
* Source Code Management


**Location**
 Katowice/Gliwice or remotely in Poland
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

**Our offer**
 Good remuneration, a challenging and international work environment, and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development.
   

  

**More Information**
 We welcome your application
 **in English.** 
 We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.
   

  

 For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Ewa Krajewska via ewa.krajewska@vattenfall.com
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall. The screening will be performed by a third party, Validata.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 21 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to enable the fossil freedom that drives society forward. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.

title: IT Projektledare
description:
**Vi söker nu efter en IT Projektledare till vår kund inom offentlig sektor.** 




  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Stötta projektägare/beställare i att ta fram projektdirektiv och behövliga underlag enligt ovanstående premisser och kundens anvisningar samt styr- och projektmodeller
* Planera projektet tillsammans med projektteamet, ansvara för att projektplanen tas fram och beslutas och därefter följs av projektet
* Säkerställa att projekt uppfyller krav inom säkerhetsskydd, informationssäkerhet och kontinuitet
* Implementera tekniska lösningar för att skydda känslig information på flera nivåer, inklusive nätverks-, applikations-, och datalager.
* Ta fram beslutsunderlag som behövs för projektets framdrift
* Driva aktiviteter och löpande rapportera framdrift och risker till styrgrupp
* Löpande informera olika intressentgrupper
* Ansvara för projektets budget och resursallokering
* Ansvara för att projektet levereras inom givna projektramar
* Hantera leverantörer och leverantörskontakter
* Vid behov upphandla ny lösning enligt kundens direktiv och processer (tex LOU)
* Leda interna projektresurser på ett tydligt och positivt sätt enligt kundens värdegrund
* Bidra till förvaltningsplanen och budgetprocessen.
* Mer information om uppdraget förmedlas om man går vidare i urvalet.



  





**Skallkrav:** 



* Certifiering inom något av följande: PPS/PRINCE2/XLPM/PROPS/PMI
* Minst 9 års arbetslivserfarenhet från roll som IT-projektledare i stora organisationer (dvs organisationer med mer än 250 anställda)
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet, under de senaste 10 åren, som projektledare av IT-uppdrag med höga krav på informationssäkerhet.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha aktivt bidragit i upphandling, inom statlig myndighet eller offentlig sektor, av IT-lösning.
* Projektlett minst 2 införanden av standardsystem där krav mot externa parter har ingått.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från agila arbetssätt och verktyg som Azure Devops eller Jira.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av ITIL kopplat till IT-produktion, förvaltning eller projektverksamhet.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift.
* Bosatt i Sverige.



  





**Placeringsort:** 
 Sundbyberg
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid på plats i kundens lokaler med viss möjlighet till distansarbete.
 



**Start:** 
 December 2024, väldigt långsiktigt uppdrag.
 



  





**Information:** 



* ***Säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll utförs på kundens begäran.***
* ***Ansök senast 2024-09-18***
* ***Urval av kandidater sker löpande och annonsen kan tas bort tidigare.***



  





**Om Agiremus** 




 Sedan 2015 har vi hjälpt flertalet medarbetare att komma ut på arbetsmarknaden samt att nå sina karriärmål runtom i Sverige. Genom att skapa och bibehålla meningsfulla relationer med våra samarbetspartners kan vi presentera en bred rad av arbetsmarknadens mest attraktiva karriärmöjligheter för våra medarbetare och kandidater. Agiremus verkar inom de flesta branscherna, både inom privat och offentlig sektor.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder:
 



 Agiremus erbjuder dig som konsult en spännande och utmanande arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att utvecklas inom din roll. Vi bryr oss om dig som och strävar efter långsiktiga samarbeten. Som konsult hos oss ges du, förutom spännande uppdrag, möjlighet att dela din resa med andra konsulter. Med jämna mellanrum anordnar vi tillfällen för er att träffas genom olika aktiviteter. Självklart kommer du även att ha en engagerad kontaktperson hos oss som finns där som bollplank och stöd. Vi erbjuder dig även goda personalförmåner som:
 



  




* Anställning med fast månadslön.
* Semester enligt semesterlagen.
* Tjänstepension.
* Heltäckande sjuk och olycksfallsförsäkring dygnet runt, årets alla dagar.
* Friskvårdsbidrag m.m.



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Teknisk systemförvaltare för utvecklingsverktyg
description:
**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 2024-09-16
 



  





  





 Svenska kraftnät är en av de viktigaste aktörerna för en hållbar energiomställning. Som
 **teknisk systemförvaltare för utvecklingsverktyg** 
 erbjuds du ett av Sveriges viktigaste IT-jobb, i vilket du varje dag kommer att bidra till Sveriges elförsörjning. Vi behöver dig för att lyckas med vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag att elektrifiera Sverige.
 



  





 Vi är i dag ca 500 personer på IT och vi kommer att växa ytterligare de kommande åren. Detta för att kunna skapa förutsättningar för Sverige att kunna fördubbla sin elproduktion och nå klimatmålen genom att helt ställa om till fossilfri energi. För att lyckas kommer vi att använda oss av den senaste tekniken för att öka kapaciteten i vår infrastruktur och samtidigt öka utvecklingstakten kring system, digitalisering och processer.
 



  





 Vill du jobba och utvecklas i en växande organisation och tillsammans med underbara medarbetare skapa en framåtlutad och robust IT-organisation, sök dig till oss!
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 I denna roll som teknisk systemförvaltare (systemansvarig IT) är du operativt ansvarig för livscykelhanteringen av Svenska kraftnäts utvecklingsverktyg. Utvecklingsplattformarna och -verktygen är kritiska för att lyckas med den pågående digitaliseringen som är nödvändig för energiomställningen.
 



  





 Ditt fokus blir att säkerställa att utvecklingsverktygen fungerar och håller sig ändamålsenliga för det behov som finns inom både verksamheten och IT. Utefter behov ansvarar du för etablering, konsolidering och, i vissa fall, avveckling av verktyg.
 



  





 Du kommer att arbeta med systemförvaltning av Azure DevOps Server-plattform, SonarQube och Artifactory. Vidare förvaltar och nyetablerar du också andra utvecklingsverktyg inom flera områden som Python, Powershell, .Net och WSL. Det ingår både operativt och praktiskt arbete i IT-systemen såsom konfiguration, felsökning, installation och uppgradering, koordinering av aktiviteter, exempelvis IT-förändringar, tillsammans med interna och externa intressenter.
 



  





 Du är del av enheten Utvecklingsförmågor och verktyg. Utöver ditt närmaste team kommer du även samarbeta med det team som ansvarar för containerplattformen OpenShift, samt Kafka, en plattform för strömmande data och integration.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi söker dig som har mycket god samarbetsförmåga och som är mån om att skapa goda långsiktiga relationer med andra. Du är van vid att ta egna initiativ och föreslår lösningar på problem som dyker upp. Du är ihärdig och trygg i dig själv, din kunskap och vägen framåt. Vi värdesätter en god förmåga av struktur, organisering och prioritering. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





*Skallkrav* 




 Vidare ser vi att du har utbildning från högskola eller universitet inom systemvetenskap eller liknande, alternativt likvärdig kompetens som har förvärvats på annat sätt.
 



  




* Flera års arbetslivserfarenhet av system- och applikationsförvaltning och ITSM-processer
* Flerårig erfarenhet av installation, konfiguration och administration av programvaror i Linux- eller Windowsmiljö
* Erfarenhet av systemutveckling där versionshantering i Git har ingått
* Flera års arbetslivserfarenhet av agila arbetssätt
* Du behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift



  





*Meriterande* 



* Erfarenhet av arbete som DevOps Engineer med både införande av DevOps-baserat arbetssätt och verktyg i Linux och/eller Windows-miljöer
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med konfiguration, drift och övrig hantering av Azure DevOps Server och liknande verktyg såsom t.ex. Atlassian Jira
* Erfarenhet av att leda team och prioritera aktiviteter inom ditt ansvarsområde



  





**Bra att veta** 



* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 % #LI-hybrid
* Sista ansökningsdag 2024-09-16. Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i samband med din ansökan.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning



  





**I denna rekrytering samarbetar Svenska kraftnät med IDG Recruitment** 
 . För frågor kring tjänsten och rekryteringsprocessen, välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Alexandra Tihinen, tel. 070-447 92 24, alexandra.tihinen@foundryco.com.
 



 Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim, ST, tel. 010-475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se.
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet.
 



 Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet.
 



 Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning.
 



 För anställning i säkerhetsklass 1 och 2 krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. För mer information om säkerhetsprövning: https://www.svk.se/sakerhet-och-beredskap/sakerhetsskydd/personalsakerhet/ ””
 



 Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar.
 



 Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: https://www.svk.se/jobba-har/var-arbetsplats/

title: Senior Frontend Developer within Savings Offering | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant development teams are focused on future- proofing SEB’s digital architecture and customer offering because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues.Does that sound like a fit for you?
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 You will be a part of the exiting journey to explore, design and develop the future of the Savings platform.
   

  

 The team is responsible for developing and maintaining Savings pension and insurance functionality in our digital channels which includes applications within the Internet Bank, mobile app and an internal system for advisors. Our main priority now is to develop new functionality to digitize and improve our pension and insurance offering.
   

  

 You will be a part of an agile team with motivated and creative colleagues that work in close collaboration with our product owners, business specialists and other teams within Technology.
   

  

**Our technical stack consists of:**
* React
* JavaScript/TypeScript
* Angular
* C# / .NET Core
* GitHub
* OpenShift
* Azure DevOps


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* Worked as a frontend developer using modern JavaScript frameworks for several years
* Worked closely with backend developers and testers to integrate micro frontends with backend APIs
* A passion for development and continuous learning of new technologies, platforms, and tools
* A proactive mind set and a strong sense of ownership and responsibility
* Lead the development of modern frontend architecture using reusable components
* Experience in agile methodologies, mentoring junior developers and sharing your knowledge
* A strong understanding of current web design principles and best practices
* A bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent


**It is meritable if you have:**
* Experience in development of micro service APIs using .NET
* Knowledge of web accessibility guidelines and tools
* Experience in DevSecOps practices
* Experience in frontend architecture
* Experience in cloud platforms
* An interest in the financial market


**What we offer:**
* Innovative company in the forefront of technology
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Attractive compensation and benefits
* Work-life balance
* Friendly and welcoming culture


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 If you are a highly motivated team player with a strong background in Cloud development, security layers, troubleshooting and a desire to contribute to our cloud transformation journey, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 29nd of September 2024. If you have questions about the position, please contact Elinor Franzén, Talent Acquisition Partner SEB, elinor.franzen@seb.se.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Relocate to Malta Dynamics 365 F&O Senior Technical Architect (Consulting/Big 4)
description:
Our client’s Microsoft Business Solutions team is a Microsoft Gold Partner and leader in Microsoft software implementations for medium to large organisations, providing their clients with the ability to keep up with the ever-changing digital world by implementing Microsoft’s M365, Azure, Microsoft’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Customer Engagement (CE) software from the Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365) software line.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 Our client’s Microsoft Business Solutions is looking for talented D365 FO who will use her/his expertise and experience for the technical realisation of tasks based on functional designs in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations in particular building and testing new and existing functionalities. This is a dynamic and exciting opportunity to join a growing new business area within a market leading firm.
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Full Time
   

  

**Work Place:** 
 Onsite
   

  

**Location:** 
 Malta, Europe (Relocate to Malta)
   

  

**Relocation** 
 : VISA & Relocation Package Included
   

  

**Requirements**
* A University graduate with a relevant degree within a computing or business discipline.
* A Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O Core Certification and a Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O Technical Certification would be considered as an asset.
* Minimum 6+ years’ experience working with Microsoft Dynamics AX and Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O.
* Experience with all stages of Dynamics 365 FO Development
* A good understanding of best practices including code management (i.e. source control), unit testing methodologies and build processes
* Strong knowledge on X++
* Good knowledge of Life Cycle Services (LCS)
* Experience in using Azure DevOps such as source control, gated check-ins and pipelines.
* Understand Devops principles
* Knowledge of Automatic Testing Language (ATL) would be considered as an asset
* Data migration (Data entities) experience in-line with D365FO data handling processes
* Experience with interfaces (SOAP, REST, custom services) would be considered as an asset
* Willing to travel abroad when required


**Responsibilities**
* Work alongside the Solution and Senior Technical Architects to help create high quality design and sustainable client solutions and project documentation;
* Implementation of technical solutions for customer requirements in D365FO
* Analyse and resolve issues within the ERP system
* Participate in development, integrations, product support, and platform updates
* Write and manage technical documents
* Ensuring all design/technical documentation is kept up to date during the development process
* Working in an Agile approach depending on the business requirements
* Working with both on-shore and off/near-shore development teams
* Deliver all development work as per Microsoft Business Solutions (MBS) standards, ensuring that all software applications are implemented successfully per the project plan: on time and on budget;
* Be an active member of technical and design working groups within the practice
* Adhere to best practice and our clients technical standards during all development
* Keep team and project Manager updated with progress
* Perform code reviews.
* Help and mentor developers.
* Assisting in Technical Interviews.
* Identify any risks and issues early and raise through the appropriate governance channels
* To carry out additional duties as may occur from time to time as instructed and agreed by the Practice management team.
* Represent MBS in a professional and positive manner at all times.
* The Employee is required to follow our client’s Information Security Policies (ISP and ISMP) at all times


**Microsoft Business Solutions Overview**
 At our client, your long-term future is every bit as important to them as it is to you. That’s why our clients aim is to give you experiences that will stay with you for a lifetime. Whether it’s great training and development, mobility opportunities or corporate responsibility volunteering activities – you’ll gain a wealth of experiences on which to build a rewarding career. They are a firm that encourages you to be yourself, values your contribution, and inspires you to act as a role model, always focused on doing the right thing for each other, their clients, and their communities.
   

  

 This sets out all the different ways you’ll be rewarded by our client. Among other things, you can benefit from honest conversations about your career as well as a range of other rewards. In all these ways and more, they have created an environment that can bring out the best in you.
   

  

 #Bethechange and #makethechange. Join our clients' talented, successful team and make the leap into the future.
   

  

 For this exciting opportunity they have put together a great package that combines a competitive salary with a bundle of extras including allowances, business travel allowances, certifications to support you in your career growth, private insurance, and medical insurance for you and your family.
   

  

 Don’t worry, they know that relocation can be a challenge, which is why they have an extremely supportive onboarding team to help you throughout this process! - They provide relocation support for you and your family.

title: Senior AI Researcher
description:
Leonardo.Ai is seeking a Senior AI Researcher to join our expanding global AI team.


This is an exciting opportunity for AI or Machine Learning professionals and academics to join the brightest minds, helping Australia’s most potent generative AI-powered platform unleash the world’s creativity through our foundational text to image model, Phoenix.


As an applied Senior AI Researcher, you will lead foundational training of our Design Models and integrate our breakthroughs into our platform to enhance user experience. This role involves mentoring junior team members and playing a key role in strategic planning.


We are hiring across multiple disciplines in AI Research and would love to hear from candidates with backgrounds in foundational model training, data exploration, systems engineering, optimisation and/or applied research science.

**Responsibilities:**

* Lead significant projects and mentor junior team members, fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment.
* Drive initiatives that advance our current AI capabilities across a variety of modalities, including our foundational model, and ensure the seamless integration of new research into our platform.
* Play a pivotal role in strategic planning, guiding the team toward achieving long-term objectives.
* Collaborate with and mentor peers in the AI team.
* Oversee strategic decision-making for AI research projects, ensuring alignment with company goals.
* Champion diversity and fair treatment within the team and in all research activities.
* Own complex problems, lead specific areas, and integrate new research work into the pipeline and workflow.
* Collaborate with the broader Leonardo team to address collective problems and ensure that Research and Product are closely aligned to enhance customer impact.
* Develop and maintain AI models, exploring, debugging, and validating them to ensure they work as intended.
* Improve data access, utilise generative AI, and develop a pro-innovation approach to AI regulation.

**Skills We Like:**

* Extensive experience in Python, deep learning frameworks, cloud computing, and software engineering.
* Knowledge of natural language processing, computer vision, ML model training, and data pipeline model creation.
* A team player attitude, capable of collaborating with cross-functional teams.
* Curiosity and the ability to stay on top of new and changing tools and techniques in the AI space.
* PhD in AI, with experience in data, ML, and AI research.
* Proven track record of writing research papers in NLP or CV and contributions to open-source AI code or repositories.

**Our Culture:**

* **Inclusive Culture**: We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued and empowered. At Leonardo AI, your unique perspectives and experiences are welcomed and essential to our success.
* **Flexible Work Environment:** We understand the importance of work-life balance. Enjoy the flexibility to work remotely or from our vibrant offices. We have employees all over Australia, ensuring you can thrive personally and professionally.
* **Empowering Growth**: Your development is our priority. We offer continuous learning opportunities and career growth tailored to your goals. You’ll be encouraged to grow and excel in your career at Leonardo AI.
* **Impactful Work**: Join us in shaping the future of AI. You'll work on innovative projects that have a meaningful impact, and your contributions will help drive advancements in AI creativity.

**Next Steps:**

If you're passionate about reading and publishing AI research papers, have a history of implementing AI models (open source/ proprietary), and are keen to be exposed to bringing models to production, this role might be the perfect fit for you.


We encourage you to apply and start the conversation whether you’re based locally in Europe or overseas.

**Why Leonardo.Ai?**
--------------------

* **Shape the Future of AI:** Join us in revolutionising content creation and build a platform at the forefront of generative AI, in an award winning culture.
* **Hybrid and Remote Options:** Flexibility is key. Choose a work arrangement that suits your lifestyle and allows you to do your best work. Our hybrid team members meet in the Sydney office 1-2 times per week, with free lunch on Fridays.
* **Benefits:** We offer a generous package including paid parental leave, home office and wellness budgets, and remote working from overseas.
* **Diversity and Inclusion:** We intentionally seek people from a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives to join our team. We wholeheartedly believe in creating an inclusive environment where every voice we hear contributes to our success.

**Typical Interview Process**
-----------------------------


While we love technology, rest assured that our interview process is all human. A Talent team member will review your application, and we'll contact you either way to let you know the outcome.Here's what you can expect.

**Round 1 - Meet Your Recruiter:**

* Our Talent team will reach out and arrange a 30-minute video call where you'll cover your experience, skills, and career motivations. You'll also get essential context about the role, the team, and how you can contribute towards our goals.

**Round 2 - Craft Interview:**

* You'll meet some team members to discuss the technical task in more depth, work through some technical questions related to your expertise and cover past projects, experience and career aspirations.

**Round 3 - Technical Task:**

* If you're applying for a technical role, you may be given a short take-home task to assess your skills and approach to problem-solving. This could be a real-life business scenario to unpack, a presentation, a test or a collaboration exercise. (Please note, depending on the role, the order of rounds 2 & 3 are interchangeable)

**Round 4 - Values interview:**

* You'll be able to meet with the Department Head for a short, informal conversation to understand your potential impact, the growth area we can support, and how aligned you are with our values and culture.

**Important Information**
-------------------------


If there are any adjustments we can make that would make you more comfortable at any point in the interview process, please don't hesitate to let us know.

This is an exciting opportunity for AI or Machine Learning professionals and academics to join the brightest minds, helping Australia’s most potent AI-powered platform unleash the world’s creativity through our foundational model, Phoenix.

title: Technical Support Specialist
description:
Are you passionate about technology and have a service-oriented mindset? Do you excel at problem-solving, take responsibility seriously, and thrive when tackling challenges alongside your colleagues? If so, continue reading!

**About the role**


As a Technical Support Specialist at Visma PubliTech, you'll be a member of a team of committed colleagues that share a passion for troubleshooting and solving problems. Your primary responsibility will be to provide technical support to our clients, which include municipalities and regions across Sweden.


In this role, your duties will centre around offering technical support and troubleshooting for our system for healthcare logistics, Sesam. This position is customer-centric, involving frequent interaction to ensure our clients receive the best possible assistance.


Your internal interactions include not only your immediate colleagues in the support team but also a broader collaboration with other teams in technology, product & development, and application consulting. Together, we are dedicated to ensuring our customers' satisfaction with our products, system solutions, and services.  

  

**Your primary tasks will include:**

* Troubleshoot and guide customers with questions and issues
* Perform version upgrades to ensure our customers are always on the latest and best developed version of the software
* Perform complete, accurate, and timely entry of information into Service Cloud (CRM) for all cases worked on by prioritising and classifying cases according to appropriate criticality
* Work continuously with improving our processes and contribute to upkeep our innovative mindset
* Prioritise high customer attendance and personal support to achieve best in class customer experience measured through tNPS
* Assist customers in shorter consulting assignments, enabling their IT to perform local installations such as server migrations, db back-ups etc.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders and contribute to a knowledge sharing environment
* Contribute to our communication and development of Visma Community and participate in events and-or webinars when arranged.

The position is a permanent employment, with Stockholm or Malmö as the primary location since most team members are based there. However, for the right candidate, other locations may be considered.

**Who are we looking for?**


We are looking for someone who is analytical and skilled at problem-solving, with a passion for diving into complex issues. You are a team player and enjoy working collaboratively. Customer focus is important to you, and you understand the value of delivering quality. You enjoy guiding clients, are perceived as service-oriented, attentive, and reliable. Additionally, you communicate fluently in both Swedish and English, both verbally and in writing.

**Requirements and personal qualities**

* Higher education in IT or similar
* > 4 years of technical customer service experience
* Ability to work in a high pace and continuously changing environment
* High attention to detail and a sense of urgency
* Excellent troubleshooting and analytical skills
* Microsoft SQL Server
* Scripting in PowerShell
* Server infrastructure, Windows server
* Ability to decipher, analyze, and troubleshoot problems related to query execution

 **What can we offer you?**


Visma PubliTech is a company within the Visma group. We benefit from being a smaller, entrepreneurial company with close collaboration and a warm, family-like culture, while also being part of one of Europe's leading IT groups. Our vision is to empower the public sector with innovative solutions that contribute to maximised business benefits and a sustainable society.


We take immense pride in our high employee engagement, placing us in the top five percent in the tech industry!

**We love to hear your ideas:** You will become part of a culture where we encourage you to try new things, valuing your initiatives and perspectives.

**Flexibility at all stages of life**: We understand that you are more than just your job. It's important for us to offer you a good balance between leisure and work. We have a flexible hybrid model of working from home and in the office, based on needs and preferences.

**Above all, we are a team**: Team spirit is what allows us to keep our promises and deliver at a high level, but it's also what enables us to promote a sustainable corporate culture where we support and care for each other.

**Application**


To apply for this position, please use the link provided. We will review applications and invite candidates for interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions or would like more information about the position, please contact Sara Mensi, Customer Success Manager, at sara.mensi@visma.com.


We look forward to receiving your application


Learn more about our Privacy Statement here: https://www.visma.com/privacy/.

title: Machine Learning / Computer Vision Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Machine Learning engineer with experience in Computer Vision to join our team. You’ll play an important role in designing the neural networks that power the core of our technology, while also owning an important part of the ML stack.

 **Key Qualifications:**

  

* Master's degree or equivalent level of experience in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, or a related field.
* Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience with neural networks, both designing and deploying them on various hardware platforms.
* Understanding of computer vision algorithms, machine learning, and software development.
* Proficiency in programming in Python, with knowledge of different Deep Learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras etc.) and OpenCV. Some knowledge of C++ is a plus.
* Basic knowledge of the MLOps stack, and basic understanding of data engineering.
* Experience with Cloud Platform, especially GCP is a plus.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Experience in Agile software development.

**Responsibilities:**




* Design neural networks for Computer Vision applications, with a focus on latency and low-computational power systems.
* Design and maintain MLOps pipelines to manage experiments, guaranteeing their reproducibility.
* Taking a part in designing and running efficient large data pipelines that feed into our training infrastructure.
* Stay updated on the latest advancements in machine learning and apply them to our technology.

title: Senior Functional PLM Consultant
description:
General information
Country
Sweden


City
Malmo


Job ID
39008


Department
Infor Consulting Services


Experience Level
MID\_SENIOR\_LEVEL


Employment Status
FULL\_TIME


Workplace Type
Hybrid


Description & Requirements
Infor Consultants work with Clients to implement Infor software and industry standard processes with the aim of reducing costs, increasing customer service, and creating frameworks for enhanced collaboration and business efficiency.  

Whilst our technology is the enabler and vehicle for achieving business benefits, the quality and experience of our consultants are key differentiators. The job holder is responsible for delivering business process and application consulting services which include process design, application configuration, testing, client training on Infor software, technologies and tools in accordance with standard implementation methods in the area of product lifecycle management (PLM). The Consultant is also responsible for developing ongoing, successful business relationships with clients and for providing clients with "industry best practice" recommendations.


Key Responsibilities

* Deliver PLM product training
* Configuration of PLM
* Prepare configuration documentation
* Prepare migration strategy plans
* Develop custom extension specifications
* Assist in implementing and testing custom extensions
* Develop and conduct test plans
* Develop training and cutover plans
* Provide support to clients from kick-off to post go-live
* Prepare weekly trip reports / progress reports
* Maintain and execute issue logs, action logs, risk logs
* Attend weekly update calls with each client
* Maintain a positive professional demeanor


Key Requirements:

* Bachelor's degree
* 3-5 years general experience
* Functional and technical experience with PLM for Process (Optiva) is a plus
* Formal customer facing consulting experience is a plus
* Fluent written and spoken English is mandatory
* Fluent written and spoken Swedish is mandatory
* Willingness to travel
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
  

  

About Infor  

Infor is a global leader in business cloud software products for companies in industry specific markets. Infor builds complete industry suites in the cloud and efficiently deploys technology that puts the user experience first, leverages data science, and integrates easily into existing systems. Over 60,000 organizations worldwide rely on Infor to help overcome market disruptions and achieve business-wide digital transformation.
For more information visit www.infor.com  


Our Values  

At Infor, we strive for an environment that is founded on a business philosophy called Principle Based Management™ (PBM™) and eight Guiding Principles: integrity, stewardship & compliance, transformation, principled entrepreneurship, knowledge, humility, respect, self-actualization. Increasing diversity is important to reflect our markets, customers, partners, and communities we serve in now and in the future.  

We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on PBM. Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, PBM™ prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.  

Infor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. Infor does not discriminate against candidates or employees because of their sex, race, gender identity, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, veteran status, or any other protected status under the law. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the infor.com/about/careers webpage.

title: Sr. Solutions Consultant
description:
**Please return soon to complete your dream job application!**
--------------------------------------------------------------

  

**Sr. Solutions Consultant**
============================

Req id: 42357
Virtual, SE  

**OPENTEXT**  

OpenText is a global leader in information management, where innovation, creativity, and collaboration are the key components of our corporate culture. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to partner with the most highly regarded companies in the world, tackle complex issues, and contribute to projects that shape the future of digital transformation.



**ITOM Sr. Solutions Consultant**

**Position**

  


Sr. Solutions Consultant

  

**Background and Purpose**

  


OpenText solutions create a measurable impact on customer’s business processes. Since they can significantly impact a customer’s bottom line and contribute to the realization of their strategies, they require a strategic and holistic view of the business. It is becoming increasingly important to demonstrate customer intimacy and stakeholder centricity in our execution.

  

The ITOM senior solutions Consultant's mission is to drive increased sales by helping prospects understand the potential value of an investment in OpenText solutions and guiding customers toward realizing that value.


The Sr. Solutions Consultant (SC) plays a key role in understanding the customer’s current IT ecosystem and strategy and building a holistic view of the OpenText solutions deployment as part of their digital transformation journey.

  


**Job and Responsibilities**

  

The Sr. Solutions Consultant is a senior-level professional, part of the ITOM Enterprise team inside the Presales community, capable of managing multiple engagements in complex environments and collaborating with many different stakeholders.

  

The SC's responsibilities include:

  


* Support corporate efforts to enable the sales teams and provide feedback about new developments in the field of IT Operations Management products (Enterprise Service Management, AIOPS, Observability, Network Operations, and Automation) and how recent trends and best practices can impact our business.

  




* Supporting the sales teams along the sales cycle from the discovery and qualification phase to the closing, ensuring internal alignment, and becoming a trusted advisor.

  




* Working with our customers to provide a consensus-based solution that is scalable, adaptable, and in synchronization with ever-changing business needs.

  




* Working closely with Account Executives to clearly communicate and sell the value and capability of OpenText’s™ IT Operations Management (ITOM) Products and Solutions.
* Developing technical demonstrations specific to customer requirements.
* Building and delivering proof of concepts.
* Assisting Account Executives in relationship management and developing technical sales information/tools.
* Interacting with Sales, Global Services, and Partners to create and finalize Solution offerings and initial Project delivery plans.
* Representing OpenText at Trade Shows and industry events.
* Participating in Territory/Account planning meetings.
* Identifying potential opportunities based on known technical requirements of customers.
* Scoping, creating, and delivering custom software presentations and demonstrations and driving synergies from similar experiences.
* Researching and completing technical RFx responses. Participate in the final review of the RFx response.
* Leading technical portions of design sessions. Document as-is and desired future state.
* Creating technical solution deliverables and delivering the presentation of the recommended solution.
* Leading the completion of Proof of Concepts (POCs) by scoping the technical requirements and creating detailed use cases for the evaluation. Conduct the evaluation per POCs’ requirements, coordinate the efforts of additional team members, lead the execution of the Use Cases, present the findings, and reiterate solution benefits.
* Analyzing data from various sources and synthesizing alternatives to create innovative solutions that will meet and evolve beyond current requirements.

  


**Candidate Profile**

  


* 5+ years of experience in a presale role selling enterprise software to business users or C Level, preferably in a SaaS/Cloud environment and/or IT experience related to IT Operations. Infrastructure (e.g., HPE, Dell), Virtualization (i.e. VMware, Red Hat), and containerization technologies (i.e. Docker, Kubernetes). VMware or Microsoft certifications are a plus (MCSA, MCSE, VCA or VCP).

  




* Experience with OpenText IT Operations Management offerings
* Certification in industry standard frameworks and/or best practices such as ITIL, eTOM, OSS/BSS, IT4IT, etc.

  




* Knowledge of the competitive landscape for IT Operations Management products

  




* Ability to build credible business cases, ROI/TCOs, and compelling proposals to our customers.
* Excellent understanding of the architectural principles for cloud-based platforms, including SaaS, PaaS, multi-tenancy, and automation.
* Demonstrated understanding and certification of one or more (AWS / Google Cloud Platform /Azure).
* Solid presentation skills.
* Time management and prioritization skills
* Problem-solving techniques
* Strong qualification skills
* Customer service orientation

  




* Team player with strong communication and collaboration skills

  




* Sharing and global mindset

  




* Self-motivated, committed to excellence

  





OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws.


If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or recruiting process, please contact us at hr@opentext.com. Our proactive approach fosters collaboration, innovation, and personal growth, enriching OpenText's vibrant workplace.
